title: Amazing and Caring
pros: Work Life balance is extremely good Promote from within primarily Flexible and understanding Great Culture and amazing company values
cons: Training is rapid and could do with more thoroughness Sometimes the pay does not seem adequate for the work completed day in and day out

title: Review after Promotion
pros: I truly enjoy this job. Yes, it can be challenging, but I do enjoy a good challenge. I believe the company as a whole is a great company. Yes, you have to have hard conversations with customers, but there is training to help you have those conversations. I think it is wonderful that the company looks within for top tier talent to promote. You make your own way with this company. If you want to move up the ladder, it is up to you to drive that development.
cons: There are not many I can think of. Oh, working Saturdays.

title: Not a bad business
pros: you work alone most of the time, the live on site apartment, building customer relationships, the district meetings are amazing, the benefits are pretty good
cons: Sometimes you hardly get coverage, your looked at as just a number, it‚Äôs actually really hard to get the correct help sometimes, pay is not enough for what they expect you to do and deal with, they will fire you without proof,

title: Benefits are decent
pros: Usually get left alone after hours. Property is usually easy to maintain. Some tenants are cool Offers decent insurance Once you've spent 10 years here, you roll up PTO pretty quick but they will cap you
cons: New people get hired on at what you make after 10 years. Management cackled when I asked for a raise. Be prepared to be the verbal punching bag after your tenants recieved $100 rate increases. You will clean up more human fecal matter than you ever thought feasible.

title: Field Operations Review
pros: Benefits, premiums not ideal but fair. Salary is better than a lot of competitors Great for employees who want minimal supervision, take ownership, and challenge themselves. Majority of time off request are granted if you have PTO
cons: While there are numerous training resources, its driven to be self motivated. Use your senior course team to interact and uplift team members in all areas not only financial results. Very narrow room for advancement in current structure

title: My input to working for Extra Space
pros: If you love to work with people and satisfy to all their needs this is the place. Great pay, Excellent Team, Work hard and earn your bonuses. I have been here 5 years and love my job.
cons: Trying to get delinquent tenants to pay. With hard times we are in, you have to be sympathetic yet provide excellent customer service when trying to collect debt. No one wants their personal items auctioned off.

title: Pleasant Work Experience
pros: My DM has BY FAR been the best manager I had out of all of the jobs I've had. It is refreshing to see a manager that cares for the employee first and will genuinely have our backs but is not afraid to correct us when we need.
cons: Just the normal confrontation you get with customers when they get a rate increase, but that is apart of our duty and it has taught me to stand up for myself and articulate in an empathetic way to the customer why they got an increase.

title: A rewarding first year with Extra Space Storage
pros: Supportive and collaborative team environment Strong focus on customer service and operational excellence Clear training programs and opportunities to learn Leadership that genuinely values feedback and employee growth
cons: Fast-paced environment can be challenging at times Some processes could be streamlined as the company continues to grow Hourly wages could be a little higher depending on locations and states

title: Extra Space is an amazing company
pros: -Great training and onboarding process -Very helpful coworkers -Supportive environment with opportunities to grow career and learn more skills -soda machines, coffee/tea/hot chocolate and snacks available
cons: I have not found any cons in the time I have been here.

title: Best Customer Service
pros: The Staff is always friendly and professional The facility is clean and secure Easy access and smooth move in process

title: Review During Promotion
pros: I like that fact that they look to promote from inside the company before looking outside the company. The people I work with are all so kind and are always willing to answer any questions.
cons: The main con I can think of is that the CPP % counts parking. A lot of parking does not get CPP due to the fact that we can only insure the items inside of the vehicle, not the vehicle itself.

title: Great Place to Work If You Love Boxes, Bolt Cutters, and Existential Questions
pros: Solid company with great benefits‚Äîhealth, dental, vision, and enough PTO to recover from forklift-related emotional trauma. Training is thorough. I now know more about disc locks than any human should. You will become a master of small talk, gate code troubleshooting, and pretending not to panic when someone asks if they can store a python in their unit. Honestly decent coworkers who share your pain and your snacks. Corporate sends swag! Not Xboxes, but hey, a pen is a start.Solid company with great benefits‚Äîhealth, dental, vision, and enough PTO to recover from forklift-related emotional trauma. Training is thorough. I now know more about disc locks than any human should. You will become a master of small talk, gate code troubleshooting, and pretending not to panic when someone asks if they can store a python in their unit. Honestly decent coworkers who share your pain and your snacks. Corporate sends swag! Not Xboxes, but hey, a pen is a start.
cons: The job walks a fine line between storage management and unpaid reality show participant. No couches in the office. Zero. My glutes haven‚Äôt touched padding since onboarding. Company meetings are NOT held via Xbox Live. A tragedy for morale, productivity, and my kill/death ratio. Summer heat + non-climate-controlled units = slow-roasting like a human Hot Pocket. You will be asked to explain why someone can‚Äôt just ‚Äúlive‚Äù in their unit. Weekly.

title: EXTRA Fake Culture
pros: I like the AM work hours
cons: I do not agree with the amount of perfect practices they make their employees endure. We have a once a week district call and 2 yearly district meetings. The company's values is fake and they have the "you get what you pay for demeanor". Since working here the customers complain about the constant Rate increases and the significant jump since they took over Life Storage. The company pushes staff to sell CPP ( Insurance) but make it optional and then try to coach employees on how to basically convince customers they need an additional monthly fee. Their is absolutely no Over Time and they ensure we do not go over time. We are always short staffed, and the DM is condescending at times with his leadership. The job is very repetitive and key word for this company is EXTRA, the customers complain the company is a Bait and switch, and also for staff. Upon being hired they do not tell you the AM will be getting paid less but to do the exact same job as the SM. They force the AM to do the SM job with different pay and less of the monthly bonus because the DM gets apart of the monthly bonus as well. I came in making $19 and got a .57 cent pay raise on my yearly review.

title: Ten Years of an Excellent Job
pros: Work Life Balance, awards and recognition, promoting from within, Great DM
cons: There are None at the moment

title: I would think twice before working for Extra Space Storage
pros: There are good customers that could make your day. As long as your district is fully staffed, work-life balance is pretty good.
cons: Upper management places too much focus on metrics and not supporting the people who work at properties. Too often, you are left working a site alone with last minute call offs or not enough staff to provide you the help that you need. Company culture has moved in the direction of being totalitarian. Some customer can be erratic due to drug use, which can be scary. There is fear of coming into contact with dangerous substances when having to enter a customers storage unit due to our auction process (Or for any other reason...). Pay is relatively low for the market considering cost of living has gone up exponentially, but pay has stayed low. There are not that many holidays that are recognized, so you will be stuck working on most holidays. Facility audits are intense and stressful. There are many opportunities for failure in sections of the audit that are out of your control. There is still no sick leave and management just claims that this is all been rolled into one large amount of PTO.

title: Good company / poor recognition
pros: Good pay for location Family time is always achievable Ability to learn and grow within the company and position.
cons: Poor pay for work and effort needed. With days off its hard to feel like youre ever refreshed. You can learn and grow, when spaces are available. However employees that do not want the position or those who do not deserve it do not face consequences.

title: Not enough paid holidays and pto

pros: The professionalism and growth is Major with this Company. Customers are great and your peers are always available with answers.
cons: The Pay is God Awful! The cost of living jumped 53% is the last 5 years in NJ, but the yearly pay increases is only 3 % if you exceed expectation. 99% of employees for Extra Space are given 2-2.5 for meeting expectation. For all the responsibilities put on our plates, the yearly increases is just laughable, This company is growing so fast and profits are at an all time high, but it all on the backs of the managers on the front lines. These profits would not be possible without their effort and they have nothing to show for it.

title: Extra Space Storage
pros: Best job of my long career ‚Äî company culture is second to none. Leadership truly cares about employees and sets us up for success. CEO Joe Margolis is an outstanding leader: kind, caring, fun, and brilliant. He makes the workplace enjoyable while pushing the company forward. title: Advancement from AM to SM

title: Work Life Balance Poor Management
pros: The workload is manageable and predictable, with ample free time that can be a positive depending on your personality. It's easy to stay busy each day. Customers are generally friendly and appreciative, though not always. The work-life balance is excellent, with set hours and no Sunday work, plus every other Saturday off.
cons: The pay is just slightly above the national average. You could potentially shine and earn a maximum 4% raise, or you could switch companies and secure a 20% salary increase for doing the same job. While growth opportunities are claimed to be available, they often require relocating to a different state for the role you want, and positions like DTL, DMIT, and DM are rarely available. Corporates anti-consumer practices, such as raising rates by over 100% a month, Creating frustration for employees who lack power and must deal with negative customer reactions. Be prepared to work independently frequently, as short staffing leads to long commutes across numerous locations, with many managers being hired simply to fill positions rather than based on the right qualifications. This often leaves other managers picking up the slack, as they can't adequately cover their sites. Managers are allowed to apply different rules at their locations, making the job more complicated. There is too much flexibility in expectations, leading to major favoritism.

title: Great Place to Work

title: Great People

title: Grateful for Extra Space!
pros: Everyone in the management team from District manager to District Team Lead is awesome.
cons: I hope you can help us increase our rates per hour. Thank you!

title: Fun job, not fun Company
pros: The job itself is a lot of fun. You work in the office and on the property. Getting rentals, cleaning units, calling delinquents, cutting locks, scrubbing floors, dusting, cleaning windows. The open hours are great, 9:30 to 6.
cons: You will get 2 days off a week as extra space will not pay overtime, but it's actually extra space illegal to have 2 days off together consistently. You have district team leads or DTL's that are supposed to be there to support you in the stores but that does not happen. They are training new hires. As an assistant they will try to have you travel all over the district, some stores being over 20 miles from your home store. You have to have a vehicle as you take the money to the bank. District managers are almost unreachable, and with corporate talk you to death when you ask for assistance. raises are 3% but if you have been there less than 365 days it's a 1%. If you ask about promotions they will say you need to work on yourself first, every time. There is not much of a difference of pay between manager and assistant, maybe 50 cents but bigger portion of monthly bonus. That monthly bonus is $11 per rental split between everyone who had clocked in at the store for the month.

title: Glad I'm leaving

cons: Little to no help, favoritism, pay, disrespect, employees are just numbers.

title: Extremely Stressful - - Severely Underpaid

The Bonus structure is unfair and designed to benefit the company. They do not compensate their representatives who have to take on all the abusive callers, properly! All they want you to do is to push their required Customer Protection Plan because it generates them a lot of money. The headaches that come with the job don't justify the Weak pay. The callers have really affected my mental health and that is why I ended up leaving!! The employees have taken a major pay deduction. They force you to work weekends here. Calls are back to back due to being short handed. Turnover is Extremely High. They can't Hire fast enough and they are often understaffed. It's sad how the cycle constantly repeats itself!!

title: I'm Retiring from Extra Space Storage
pros: I'm almost 50. I've worked since I was 14. I've had so many jobs in my life, I can't even remember them all. But I can remember that NO job I've ever had has ever really given a care about me as a human being. They've cared about what I can do for them. At ESS, they care about what we can do for each other. Yes, there are things they ask of me, but for what I get in return, this is the ABSOLUTELY best job I've ever had. From my teammates to my Team Lead to the President of the company, Joe Margolis, everyone at ESS is approachable, empathetic, and solution focused. I've had the experience of working in multiple roles at ESS, starting as an Assistant Site Manager, getting quickly promoted to Site Manager, then, due to personal reasons, transferring to a call center position. In each of these roles, I had caring supervisors, involved district management, and interested higher management. A lot of companies talk about "culture", but the culture they describe is nothing like the actual culture an employee experiences. At ESS, it isn't just lip service. They do care about making this a true positive, supportive culture. I plan to stay here for the rest of my career due to the wonderful culture, fair compensation, and the fact that they follow through with what they promise.
cons: Any cons are so far outweighed by the pros that they aren't even worth mentioning.

title: great culture
pros: great co workers and always someone to help answer questions and lead you in the right direction
cons: too much pressure regarding getting google reviews

title: Love My Employer
pros: I have been employed with ExtraSpace Storage for a few years now. I was recently a DMIT at my old retail job. I made a transition from the fast pace retail world and came learn the storage business. It was the best transition I ever made. During my interviewing process with the DTLS and DM I was made promises like most employers make (most employers lie to you) but ESS has done way more than kept their promises but they have also gone above and beyond in the dark hours of need. This is the only employer who I have worked for that has honored their core values and makes sure their employees are happy. My District Manager is also the best DM I have ever worked under. They make the workplace fun and for once I am not scared to see their car pull up in my parking lot. Its a good day when they come to visit unlike my past events at former retail chains i worked for. I still have a long ways to go for my retirement but this is where I will retire from. ESS for Life!
cons: I wish we had more exposure to more sites to see how each store is different from the next one.

title: 5 out of 5 experience
pros: Extra Space Storage is amazing! So far I've only been with the company for about 6 months and its been the best work experience that I've ever had. The full team welcomed me with open arms and I have been able to keep an appropriate work/life balance since starting in July. Aside from that the work infrastructure creates a easy and smooth environment that enables myself to solve any problems during the work day, thanks ESS!
cons: Clarity! Although the training experience and guidelines have been great. there have been a few times where the rules and regulations of the company have been left for myself to interpret. This isn't necessarily a "con", however it does create room for error where there doesn't have to be.

title: Pretty good
pros: Super chill depending on the area you‚Äôre in/ store.rental season is terrible if you‚Äôre anywhere near TCU and is dead when it‚Äôs not rental season.i find myself chilling a lot.its a really good team and good company if you don‚Äôt want something serious as a career
cons: It‚Äôs hot in the summer cold in the winter. Be prepared to burn or freeze since half your job is outside.DMs can be a little non communicative sometimes

title: Needs Improvment
pros: Steady work and benefits where good.
cons: Some expectations are based on YOY results and the landscape of the storage industry is complex. I understand the need of growing the business but make sure it is realistic and achievable. SMART goals could be used. Dealing with difficult tenants is hard. It requires patience and understanding. Not enough training provided for this. They expect you to know these things from the beginning

title: Not a great company for people with families
pros: The people you work with are ok
cons: People talk about others behind their backs. Upper management forces you to use PTO to have more than one Saturday off even if it conflicts with child care they also do not care about the weather or road conditions they expect you to show up even if the county says no travel unless it is an emergency. The pay isn't that great for what you have to deal with and good luck advancing they only promote those they like. The company is very political and will throw their values in your face even if you do not agree with it they force their views down your throat even if it goes again your values or religion and they don't care unless it makes them look good.

title: We are a work family
pros: Yearly raises, great employees, great work balance from office to outside work. Live on site for affordable rent. Monthly bonus but only good if your at a large site like myself.
cons: Work hours, have no time for anything after work. Only 1 Monday and Saturday off a month. Yell at you for any amount of OT.

title: Great Company
pros: Great company. Awesome work/life balance
cons: Pay could be better based on industry average

title: Awesome Company
pros: teamwork, empathy, understanding, decent pay
cons: time, work saturdays, and micromanaging,

title: Decent gig
pros: Environment not too stressful, customer service is customer service. Work at own pace. And the pay is decent
cons: Meeting monthly goals and metrics

title: It‚Äôs cool for what it is
pros: Good work culture, decent pay, pretty good employees for the most part
cons: Can only take Saturday off if you have PTO, crazy customers, not enough paid holidays

title: Not enough pay
pros: Great medical benefits. They cover a lot.
cons: Floating assistant managers. Its never consistent. They don't put effort because they are scheduled at a different store the next day. So no accountability. Schedule is constantly changing. One day you think you're going to get help for the day and then they take your help last minute. Also putting in requests a month in advance. Yet the scheduled is released last minute.

title: Shady Business Practices
pros: Good work environment, time split between office work and janitorial work. Just a job for a paycheck.
cons: Angry customers because company will not tmsay the monthly price will increase and do not give a proper notice. Computer systems are extremely complicated and often crash in the middle of customer interaction. Payroll system made many mistakes on paychecks. No home location causing you to work different locations daily causing confusing routine changes. Your only supervisor is only seen maybe once a month so you rely on the help of others. Some say it's not their job, some are constantly complaining and you are always getting different answers. Low pay and the title "manager" is misleading since all employees are managers. Not really a career when the pay is slightly above minimum wage and advancement positions rarely open.

title: Decent job, terrible company
pros: bare minimum responsibilities aren‚Äôt so bad good benefits
cons: terrible pay so much expectation to work outside of job description horrible time off policies raises are terrible KPIs are basically nonsense horrible treatment of customers

title: Decent pay but upper management constantly changes
pros: Benefits are good but costly. Pay is decent. My manager is great.
cons: 3 district managers in a year's time

title: Feels Like Highschool
pros: Don't have to be in an office all day, customers for the most part are alright. The work isn't too bad on its own. It's the other managers and higher ups that make it miserable.
cons: Extremely clique like team - feels like being back in high school and almost everyone is two faced.

title: Decent
pros: Hours of operation and type of work
cons: Management skills aren't always professional

title: Great growth potential
pros: Sunday off and usually set schedule and mileage
cons: Turnover and Mergers can make this job always changing

title: Strong Team and Helpful Coworkers/Superiors
pros: I've worked at ESS for almost months now and I will say that if you ever need help, you are one phone call, text or email away to get help. Your DTL and DM are always available to help in all situations and are happy to do so. Everyone is still learning, and ESS is the one company that truly understands that. Highly recommend working here if you want your Team leads to have your back and are able to help you with anything.
cons: Pay could be better. If you look at a job opening 3 hours away in the same state, they pay $3 more for starting, or just down the road, In n Out is paying more starting than a Store Manager gets with experience. Kinda unfair

title: im just here to see something
pros: was asked a question now im answering
cons: was asked a question now im answering let me read damnit

title: Decent company to work for
pros: Pay is decent and company expectations are communicated effectively
cons: Position is a little boring at times and be a little monotinous

title: Great Job!!!
pros: Stress free, calm environment with great teams
cons: some locations can be monotonous

title: Support, Work-Life balance, and Growth
pros: Whether you need it or not extra space storage provides a great environment for learning and support all while keeping an impressive work-life balance that not many companies offer, Since I've been with the company I've managed to feel comfortable enough to not only look forward to come to work but to get the satisfaction that I'm helping customers with the tools that I've learned while being here,
cons: At times it can feel like as a team we are a bit stretched thin. On average there are one to two workers at any given time in a site, So if there is a unexpected call-out or coverage needed at another location. It throws a wrench in the daily or weekly plans and forces an excess workload for a site when it happens.

title: Best Secret Ever
pros: I have been in retail my whole career about 30 years now. I worked every holiday and thought that retail is all I would do. Then by chance saw a posting for an Extra Space DM role and thought I would give it a shot. Interviewing was not easy as I had about 6 of them but after the 3rd I was hooked, and it was now a mission. This was because the company is rooted in its core values, and they want to ensure they bring on individuals that will develop and grow leaders. I'm learning a new industry where they invest in my growth and development and are interested in hearing my feedback as an experience DM. My leaders have been inspiring and supportive through my on-boarding and I'm excited to see where this new career will take me.
cons: It's dirty sometime. There are times you have to get into site's that are not the most pleasant.

title: Extra Space Storage - Facilities Department
pros: Extra Space Storage offers a generally positive working environment. The company's overall culture promotes inclusivity and values employee contributions. Compensation and benefits are competitive, aligning well with industry standards. There are ample opportunities for career growth and development within most departments in the company. The company‚Äôs mission and values are clear, and it strives to maintain a customer-focused approach.
cons: The leadership in the Facilities department is notably rigid and controlling. This contrasts sharply with the company's broader culture. Facilities employees are not afforded the same perks or benefits as other home office employees, such as hybrid work schedules. Unless traveling to sites, Facilities staff are required to be physically present in the office. The leadership within this department rarely, if ever, offers praise or recognition for the team's hard work and accomplishments. Instead, the feedback tends to focus predominantly on what is being done wrong, creating a negative atmosphere. The morale within the Facilities team is low, with many employees actively seeking other opportunities, both within the company and externally.

title: Career Builder
pros: This is career building job, you literally start from the bottom and work yourself to management or corporate within a respectable amount of time. An amazing blend of customer service, office, and hands-on work. The culture is pretty cool, very inclusive and I feel confident saying that once joined, you don't feel like a stranger (unless thats your thing..)
cons: No cons honestly, because everything with this job is as to be expected. For example, If the storage property is located in a rough neighborhood, expect 'rougher' people BUT! with that comes some sureties like easier CPP and better security on site.

title: Great for Customer Service centric employees
pros: I have been a customer service and administrative professional for 10-12 years. I started in the Storage industry only one year ago and was quickly promoted from an Assistant Manager to a Store Manager at Extra Space Storage. Running a facility is a combination of Janitorial work, property maintenance, security, office management, administrative duties, customer service and sales. Customers and the $ bottom line are the ultimate goals they emphasize. Overall, the company goals are fairly easy to achieve as long as you are following the processes and the training the company emphasizes on a regular basis.
cons: The position is heavily centric on customer service which can be challenging at times especially working with the general public We are the face of the company and if the customer has experienced a rate increase or another problem with our company, we are required to try and de-escalate and calm angry or upset customers. We can experience run -ins with people that are living in or stealing from our facilities. It feels like we are almost police at times in that you have to stand your ground with unstable people. It can be unnerving at times especially since the store is usually only run by 1-2 people. You might be by yourself at the facility most times.

title: Extra Space is an incredible place to work
pros: Extra Space is a company where Values are very important. The people who get promoted the ones who live them every day. Passion, Excellence, Teamwork, Innovation, and Integrity are not just words posted on a wall, but are what really drive the culture of the organization. Work/life balance is stressed more so than any other company I have worked at prior. Also the senior leadership team is very down to earth and it feels like a small family business - even though we are the largest self store business in the country. I had a hard time finding a company that was willing to take a shot on me after being laid off from my prior employer, as I was not relocatable and had worked several years in the fitness industry. Operations experience seemed to have become more specialized and it was challenging to find a company willing to look at someone without experience within their industry. I am so thankful for the opportunities that I haven been given by Extra Space and look forward to many more years here.
cons: I don't have any cons

title: Great opportunities for growth!
pros: Most store manager positions come with nice apartments (mine is a gorgeous 2br 1ba with appliances and a 2nd story balcony). While you are working towards that, this is still a great job! Most stores get Sundays off close at 6pm most nights, early on Saturday. We have a huge amount of autonomy in our roles, and the customers are nice (for the most part, this is still customer service after all). I like that every day is a little different and you aren't stuck in an office, you are outside cleaning and managing your property, as well.
cons: The downsides of storage are definitely break-ins, possible pest issues, leaks, etc and having to have those hard conversations with customers. Also when their rates go up people come in very upset, but we do have some power of negotiation to help retain their business.

title: Kiss butt or you‚Äôll never get a promotion
pros: - Free time when store isn‚Äôt busy.
cons: You‚Äôre a janitor, thats also expected to perform the role of an in office professional.

title: They could do better.
pros: Generous PTO from the start. Pay is decent for starting out as a young person if you choose this career path. Medical has several family plans that are decent. Bonus paid monthly. There is career advancement. You get an allowance for work shoes and shirts are provided.
cons: Very few holidays. We work Labor Day, Memorial Day, and MLK Day. Most of the time it's not worth even being open because most customers think you are closed. The bonus is not great. You get a dollar amount per rental which you share with assistants. Sometimes they randomly change the amount with no warning. It will add $1 to $2 an hour to your check. Assistants get about half that. Work life balance is not great because someone else writes your schedule. It's rare to get two days off in a row. You will get micromanaged by most District Managers. DM's act like schoolteachers punishing the whole class because of the few bad employees. You cannot wear jeans.

title: Loved my job/But...
pros: Good benefits Good pay Great employees
cons: No write ups or warnings given

title: Great W/L balance, mediocre pay, Communication needs improvement
pros: Actual work load is (usually) very small and predictable, lots of free time which is a plus depending on your personality Customers are usually friendly and thankful Management are very accepting and flexible
cons: Pay is okay-not amazing-, but you can see that your site generates multiple 10s of thousands a month and the pay can feel unfair especially when all the labor is done solo. Anti-consumer practices from corporate (i.e. hiking rates 100+ a month) lead to employees who dont have alot of power dealing with the extremely negative reactions from customers Short staffing that leads to excessive commutes at WAY too many locations to keep track of. Different managers are allowed to have different rules for their locations making the job more difficult than it has to be; too much leniency on expectation variability

title: Most Family Friendly Job I've ever Had
pros: As a lifelong big box retail manager used to a frantic pace, unpredictable schedule, and crazy shifts, I can confidently say that Extra Space Storage offers none of this. If I'm sick, I stay home without fear of being labeled as lazy. If I have a family engagement, my co-workers help me because they have families too and there's an understanding that the favor will be returned. Neighboring locations help each other out all the time and the overall culture is warm and friendly, especially if you do what you're supposed to do. My plan is to retire here.
cons: You're probably not gonna get rich at Extra Space.

title: Store Manager
pros: What drew me to the company was the culture. Company culture is not just a slogan or statement on the website or in a picture on the wall. For it to be true, the culture has to be led by those in top leadership all the way down the organization. This is as positive culture as I have experienced in my work career. The growth in this company is phenomenal and is creating many opportunities.
cons: You must be a self starter and able to manage your time. When you work in the store you work alone or with one other person. If you need lots of direction and guidance, not a job for you. If you like managing your own day, time and task...Great Job!

title: ESS EXPERIENCE
pros: Equal work rights. Extra space Make it easy for you to feel as if your apart of the team from the beginning. The company cares about how your viewed and treated. Training is sufficient and easy as long as your good with following instructions. Giving equal opportunity to grow in this company and become a better Leader to better assist your team.
cons: Not being able to decorate the office for the holidays. Not being able to denote PTO directly to whom we want. If a team member needs PTO and doesnt have I feel we should have a choice whom we are denoting our time too.

title: Extra Space is Stuck With Me
pros: The pay is good compared to other jobs in my area. Extra Space acknowledges your hard work and finds ways to reward you for it. For me, a quick promotion. I appreciate how they monitor your success and always congratulate you on your wins. This company likes to hire from within, so if you do a good job you can most definitely advance. I am truly happy to come to work and I love the variety in the day-to-day operations. You work in the office and out on the property, which is so great for someone who doesn't want to be at the desk for the full day.
cons: Working Saturdays and working until 6 pm. Although, you can alter your schedule or request PTO if you need a Saturday off :)

title: My Honest Opinion
pros: Core Values and Teamwork: : In my opinion, ESS thrives on it's core values (ITPIE); our DMs not only talk about it, but they embody these values. We are a functional team, and working with each other to achieve the best possible outcome. Work/Life Balance: ESS provides a very good work life balance, in the short while I've been here, District Managers that I've worked with respect life changes and work with you. There's a lot of flexibility as it pertains to scheduling.. Work time is from 9:30am to 6pm, You really can't beat that. Compensation: Having evaluated the MAJOR competitors (I don't think I am allowed to mention them on here), managers at the store level I believe is compensated slightly better when it comes to the industry. Customer and Value: I believe company has better customer value in comparison to it's competitors, at least in my area and company is very right in translating that value in form of pricing. In a nutshell, we have more "Valuable" Customers with less headaches than our competitors.
cons: Lack of Growth/No Upward Trajectory: As a store manager, just like most organizations, there's no Retail-To-Corporate Path. I guess there's no encouragement for employees to improve themselves and academics to go up the ladder. Once you're a store manager, that's it. Just my opinion Metrics and Performance: Company relies on metrics which folks at the store level has no control over. For instance, you can't judge me if a customer doesn't rent or a customer who calls the store support center multiple times and complain because they're not having their way. I feel the metrics are an inaccurate indicator of one's performance but again, Just my opinion.

title: A great company, but very hard on its employees and doesn't give many chances at all
pros: great training; very kind staff for the most part. Not bad pay, you can earn commision
cons: 2 mistakes and you're gone basically.

title: Honestly, cant complain
pros: Realistically, there are many pros that come with this position. For one, we are essential workers so we have a higher job security than most. Our pay is greater than a lot of the storage places around. My DM personally is one of the most personable & supportive DMs you will ever meet. Very big on promoting within so it makes you want to work better, The shifts arent all crazy hours. No crazy late hours or overnight. Theres so much than just selling storage that you can learn & implement in your daily lives. Data entry, maintenance, landscaping, personal skills. Genuinely appreciative of this job.
cons: Not enough snacks & sometimes the building you work in creeps you out.

title: Good Company
pros: Coworkers Positive and willing to train
cons: Training was good but felt as if your being to noisy with customers to push a sell

title: Not the best, not the worst either
pros: No micromanaging Off on Sundays
cons: Hours are not very flexible especially if you always work alone Customer can be needy/ unfriendly depending on the location Short staffed, AMs getting hot potatoed throughout the district

title: OK place to work
pros: Autonomy No micro Managing Growing fast
cons: Travel from site to site They only focus on only sales but do not promote it as a sales position.

title: Okay
pros: Sundays off, working alone, has health benefits,
cons: Having to do auction paperwork, pay could be more, expected to be handyman

title: Great Place To Work
pros: I have had many job opportunities and wanted a company that will work with you and has same goals as I do. I found them at Extra Space Storage! They will continue to support your develpment and encourage you to grow. I am currently an Assistant Manager and looking forward to one day becoming a Store Manager and moving forward. They under stand family values and will work with you when needed. Great work and life balance.
cons: I honestly do not have any downsides at the moment. It is a great job, good benefits. The only thing I would think is that having outside units and being in the cold or heat for a little bit, but that is most places you work that require some outside activities to be done.

title: Pay rate is LOW
pros: Sorry, could not think of any.....
cons: 1. Their pay rate is low compare to other same positions in the same field. 2. There is only 4 paid Holidays in a year, 3. We're always short staffs at our big location, you will have to work twice as hard compare to other small sites. 4. They will give you a low 2-3% raise, even if you are a good hard working employee. If you ask for a raise, they will just say take it or leave without even considering how valuable you are for the company.

title: Open Communication
pros: Extra Space is a national company and a leader in the storage industry. The large corporate structure provides extensive communication and support in management, technology, employee benefits, learning, etc. They matched employee donations to our choice of charities during the holidays. They provide incentives toward health benefits, and help offset the costs. They provide excellent live Help Desk options with real people to work out computer problems, gate issues, accounting issues, etc. You are not left hanging!
cons: Staff shortages and single coverage on many sites can be stressful. Meeting the ever increasing metrics requirements while working alone is sometimes difficult.

title: Great Culture, Very Inclusive / Pay is subpar, Scheduling needs improvement
pros: Pro‚Äôs: * Staff and Upper management are attentive and loyal. Communication is great. * Culture is diverse and inclusive * Training available * Great benefits, 401k with employer match, good daily hours
cons: Cons: * Pay does not meet expectations. Store level employees wear a lot of hats from maintenance, vendor relations, advertising, inventory management and sales. Monthly metric requirements. Many full time store employees with 5+ yrs in still qualify for government assistance. * Advancement opportunities are slim unless you are willing to relocate. * Scheduling - get ready for a ton of weekly tasks with ‚Äúmaybe‚Äù one day of assistance , the rest you are on your own. And surprise, sometimes you get your next week‚Äôs schedule on Friday right before close or even Saturday. * PTO is cumulative and a decent amount, but good luck taking it during the last half of the year. If you have kids or family get ready to choose one holiday between August and December and you *might* get approved. And only 4 paid holidays a year.

title: Extra Space Storage is a Great Place to Work
pros: My District Manager empowers me to run the business, and supports me when I need it. I feel appreciated and valued. The company innovates using our feedback and input. I am celebrating my 10 Year Anniversary. 4 years ago I transferred from Florida to Oregon. Our business does well during times of economic ups and downs. During my 10 years with the company they have not cut back on staffing, They acknowledge we are the reason why our company is better than competitors. Benefits are great!
cons: Remember this is a Multi Billion Dollar Corporation sometimes there can be a disconnect between field and Upper Management. Annual pay increases are small but we do get them.

title: Still mad years later
pros: Free gaslighting, free anxiety, free favoritism
cons: got fired from this job years ago. My life is 1000 times better now. I opened up my own buisness and am successful. I think what made me push so hard to be successful is the torture I endured at ESS. It was so awful for 5 years of my life that I knew after I never would want an employer to treat me so bad ever again. Now fast forward and I have my own employees now and make more than ESS would pay even if they 1 every 20 years promoted a store manager to a district manager. I will never treat my businesses, my employees or any other human being as bad as ess treated me.

title: Supportive team
pros: I really enjoyed working at extra space and would say of the big name companies it's probably top of the list. They are a good company even after you separate from them they don't screw arounf with your pay and you get everything u had coming unused pto was cashed out even monthly bonuses were paid consistently they are a fair company and they don't make goals out of reach. Christmas bonus paid . They also were considerate of my mom's passing I can't thank them enough for that .
cons: The training was too intense . I had a hard time taking it all in

title: Not worth it
pros: Sundays off each week end
cons: District managers play favoritism and are like high school mean girls

title: Growing fast is not always a good thing
pros: Work/life balance, hours of operation, self paced, not a labor intensive job.
cons: Low pay, DM is disrespectful/unprofessional, favoritism, opportunities for real advancement are limited.

title: Weigh your options
pros: You get consistent 40 hours per week, but your day off consistently rotates, so you never know what day you will be. Slow work environment. Bonus money for how the store performs.
cons: As an AM, you are expected to go anywhere and everywhere in your district no matter how far away it is. I was supposed to cover stores from Lecanto to lutz. That is way too far. In addition, the people scheduling had their favorites that they didn‚Äôt send to other cities except if it was absolutely necessary, while others were gone all the time. Then what sense does this make? Person 1 would be assigned to store 1, but is scheduled for store 2 while person 2 is scheduled for store 1. Hours are still being used up in both stores‚Ä¶ keep the people assigned to stores in their stores to help their customers that they have built rapport with. On top of this, I was hired with the pitch that you get mileage and drive time, but the mileage you claim is the difference of what you actually drive and your normal drive. Then they did away with travel time because too many people were having to leave early. Inconsistent scheduling that makes no sense. I was told a store was supposed to have double coverage and that I was her only day of it, but she still had someone else scheduled there another day. You CANNOT have over 40 hours. If you get called in on your day off, you are expected to take a longer lunch to compensate. Some days drag on and on because it‚Äôs so slow.

title: Great company
pros: Live on site, team work
cons: Work by yourself sometimes, and get double coverage once or twice a week

title: EXTRAordinary Company!
pros: Work-life balance exists here at EXR. Management and leadership care about you, and the company culture is truly invaluable. If you work hard and show up, they reward you tenfold, and I've seen and experienced it firsthand. I plan on staying here for many years to come if the company continues to go the way it has been. I'm thankful for this company and all it stands for!
cons: Management allows toxic/negative employees to stay at the company for far too long, even after hearing about complaints from coworkers/employees and seeing the issues firsthand. Our culture exists because of the great people we have. Let people find out that the grass isn't always greener on the other side.

title: Best Place to Work
pros: The culture of this company is unlike anything I have every seen. When I first started, I interviewed with my district manager who seemed to care for his employees a lot. I thought maybe I just got lucky. Then I started meeting some of the other employees and realized it was the whole district. I thought "cool", maybe I just got a great district. As I worked more over the last couple years, and started helping in other states, districts, and divisions, it is all over the company. It is incredible how much everyone works together! And the leadership is always looking out for their teams!
cons: None! Honestly... nothing! I don't have a single bad thing to say about this company.

title: Could be so much better
pros: The goal is to make you a manger so unless you just dont make the cut you will become a manager. Once you become a manger you will have your own store and pretty much be able to do a lot of things your way, within the guidelines of course. You will work by yourself mostly so that cuts out a lot of work place drama but you will need to be the kind of person that doesnt need a lot of supervision and can handle being alone 90 percent of the time. The golf cart and power tools are fun. The work is mostly easy. Cleaning units is usually basic not too crazy most of the time. You can go outside when you want to and you come back in the office when you want, Your not too micromanaged. The benefits are okay nothing spectacular but they do give you a wellness credit and there is choices so that is nice.
cons: The split days off are hard if you have kids or are a caretaker, especially if you are single with kids or caretaking; you will constantly be playing catch up in your personal life. The work life balance that they brag about isnt really all that great. You will start at 930 and get off at 6, late start but its still a long day. We only get 5 holidays off, The big 3 day holidays, Memorial and Labor Day, we just sit here, Most of the time you will go hours without seeing anyone. There is no option for part time hours, only part time days. You will work almost every Saturday until 530, I only earn 4.62 hrs PTO every 2 weeks, It takes forever to earn enough to take a week off and you dont get any sick time or vacation time so you have to use PTO for everything. The google and mobile app review is ridiculous. They do not advertise so they push you to get google reviews every month and there is no compensation or bonus for that and the new mobile app metric is ridiculous. If people do not want their app on their phone you get bad numbers. They raise people's rent for no reason, to ridiculous amounts, more than apartment raises and customers call yelling at you, but they dont want you to tell them its headquarters, they just want you to take the verbal abuse. There is no long term customer reward and you take the hit for that, by customers and in your numbers. The pay is "okay", just average, its not the worst but considering how they brag about their profits it could be better. Also you will deal with homeless people trying to live in their units and then you have to go through all kinds of changes to get rid of them- being threatened, cleaning up poop, fixing destroyed units, all because they want to collect one more months rent. Sometimes it feels like they really dont care about our safety, only the months rent. Also once you become a manager there is not a lot of options unless you are willing to relocate and jump thru hoops.

title: Good place to work
pros: Leadership, opportunity in bigger markets and stability
cons: Pay wasn‚Äôt enough for lift style

title: Some pros but a lot of cons
pros: The main pro is that unless you are in the cities, the job is extremely easy. Even in the cities, the actual job is fine, it is just you have increased customer interaction. The other pro is the work-life balance. The only time you ever have to deal with something off hours is when there is an emergency.
cons: For starters, the pay is not great. They almost have like a vendetta against paying overtime. They try to act like they are making it better by paying you a bonus at the end of the month based on your rentals. However, for most sites you are maybe looking at an extra $50 - $150 depending on where you are. And they lower the incentive that you get per rental during busy season, they claim that due to the higher number of rentals that it evens out. That being said the number of rentals are not guaranteed. For example, they raised our rates so high that we did not get rentals to the point we ended up with 30 less rentals then the same month a year prior. In terms of pay and abilities, moving up in the company is really not worth it depending on what your goals are. If one of your goals is learning about the business, this is not the place. Whether you are with the company or not, you can find the information. You will probably have to do the same amount of digging. Despite the company claiming transparency, they are anything but. If you ask the company 10 questions, you will get the answer to maybe one of them. They love to give long winded responses that do not answer the question. You could also get as specific as possible and format a question by stating the information that you know, and then saying but you would like to know. 9 times out of 10 they will give you a response, restating everything you said you knew and not answer the question. Another con is that your previous work experience does not really mean anything to them. They will speak to you in such a cookie cutter way, that it can be very condescending. Even if you have been there a while and know your clientele, they act like you don't know anything. Despite the fact that when you survey all the guests, 80% of them would make a statement consistent of them staying there due to the office management. The amount of guests that make statements how they do not like the company but like us is astounding. Extra Space benefits greatly off of us and the fact that other companies seem to have employees that really do not care. I could go on, but to put it into perspective, I have talked to loads of people who have been here for 5+ years and they all have stated that this is just a job, not a career. There are also loads of people who were interested in the job and are now contemplating leaving. The only thing keeping them is how easy the job is.

title: Life is storage
pros: Great benefits included eye and dental
cons: If you don't understand how to do something you definitely reach out for the answer. But it would definitely be nice to know how to get the answers without having to call in front of a customer. And want a Saturday off they talk a lot about life, work balance. In almost 2 years I can think of 3 Saturday's I have had off. So much for a weekend of anything but work. And believe me when I say you are assured that just about once every couple of weeks you will get a new rule. According to who your speaking to. It's a hot mess in so many ways. I really wanted this job. Something tells me I will never make it. There's so much I could go on about. No need....

title: Best company I've worked for, but not without it's faults
pros: -Consistent schedule, Sundays always off -The pay is very good compared to the rest of the storage industry -Decent work hours, and full time no matter what -No micro-managing from above, employees are expected to be self-sufficient which I appreciate -work life balance is very reasonable, apart from emergencies I don't have to worry or think about work when I am off -Organized training resources -They make a genuine effort to have districts feel like a team
cons: istent schedule, Sundays always off -The pay is very good compared to the rest of the storage industry -Decent work hours, and full time no matter what -No micro-managing from above, employees are expected to be self-sufficient which I appreciate -work life balance is very reasonable, apart from emergencies I don't have to worry or think about work when I am off -Organized training resources -They make a genuine effort to have districts feel like a team

title: Nice company to work remote

cons: does not offer enough paid time off.

title: Terrible Pay
pros: Easy hours and that's about it

title: Found My Perfect Home at Extra Space
pros: I am incredibly grateful to have found my home at Extra Space. The company fosters a supportive and empowering environment where growth and collaboration are truly valued. The leadership is encouraging, the team is dedicated, and the opportunities to develop both personally and professionally are endless. I feel appreciated and inspired every day to contribute to a culture that prioritizes excellence and customer satisfaction. If you're looking for a workplace where you can grow, be challenged, and feel a sense of belonging, Extra Space is the place to be!
cons: I genuinely cannot think of any cons - it‚Äôs rare to find a workplace that checks all the boxes, but Extra Space has truly exceeded my expectations.

title: Assistant property manager
pros: A lot of free time.
cons: Poor leadership, the pays not good.

title: Overall Greatness
pros: The atmosphere at the job is just so welcoming, the different people you meet each day, the relationships you build not only with staff but with customers as well, I have not once yet while being here said "damn I don't want to go in to work today"
cons: I don't have too many cons for this job, I've really been happy here

title: Micromanaging at its finest
pros: Small freedoms to run your store as you want. Very tiny monthly bonus if you get customers (sometimes stores aren‚Äôt busy)
cons: KPI metrics are not realistic if you work at a slow store yet they will pressure to perform. Do I go and knock doors? Company is in financial turmoil and the pressure is rolling downhill. Nitpicking about appearance and property issues. Scrubbing walls and painting all the while you‚Äôre expected to meet goals with zero customers. Zero opportunity for days or week at a time. Authority structure is meaningless. Everyone is a peon. Including the managers. Not enough chiefs. Everyone is an Indian.

title: The Real Employee Experience
pros: I've been with the company for 4 years; started as an Assistant during Covid and within 2 years was promoted to Storage Manager. These are my appreciations for the company: Monthly bonus Positive job/performance training Inclusive staff and upper management Flexible schedules Positive and Interactive work culture
cons: Can be short staffed due to inconsistent support in stores. Limited acknowledgement and days off for federal holidays. Fast paced training can be a bit overwhelming.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: -Easy work -Great co-workers -Inclusive -Understanding Management -Great pay compared to other storage companies -Excellent Team Work -Great Communication from upper management -Promotion Opportunities
cons: The advertised work life balance is more for people without children. 9:30-6 is right in the middle of the day to where you don‚Äôt have time for anything in the morning or in the evening‚Ä¶

title: Great place to grow and learn
pros: I have grown with the company since I started. I have learned valuable life lessons as well as have walked away with things that help me in my day to day life. I have also met some of the most motivating people and made positive connections in the work place. I have always been one to steer clear of the boss, but my boss always has something helpful to say and always has feedback that continues to help me grow.
cons: Work load is sometimes over whelming depending on what is happening.

title: A great place to grow and develop
pros: This job offers a lot of autonomy to make decisions with very little "micromanaging", which is unique. Our day to day is what we make of it, meaning the productivity is on us and our ability. I enjoy the 40 hour work week quite a bit, and the company is great about a healthy amount of PTO. Work/life balance actually exists when you work here. Incredibly inclusive company as well,
cons: Innovation could be better, specifically in other areas (not related to operations, which is great). Things like the Learning and Development materials are outdated (by a few years in some cases), and some of our operational tasks are outdated as well.

title: Becoming a Storage Warrior: Tales from the Vault
pros: The Power of the Key Ring: There is a moment when you become the keymaster. Every customer who walks in looks to you like you're holding the Ark of the Covenant. And guess what? You are! No one else can enter the sacred storage chambers without your mighty key ring. It's basically a medieval dungeon master's staff, except more polished and with fewer dragons. The Warehouse Gym: Sure, you came to work thinking you were just going to move some boxes, but by the end of the week, you‚Äôre basically an Olympic athlete. Lifting cleaning bottles, climbing ladders, and restalking.5 lb-pound boxes into small spaces on the merch wall? All in a day's work. If you're looking to replace your gym membership, just sign up here and get the "Storage Arms" of Hercules. Customer Interactions that Feel Like You‚Äôre in a Sitcom: Every day, you get to meet characters straight out of a sitcom. There‚Äôs the overly dramatic person who insists their belongings are ‚Äúmore valuable than gold," the confused customer who thought they were renting a mini fridge (yep, it‚Äôs a storage unit, not an appliance), and of course, the person who insists you‚Äôve ‚Äúmisplaced‚Äù their stuff‚Ä¶even though it's right in front of them. The Sweet Smell of Opportunity: Every time you step foot into the office, you‚Äôre greeted by the sweet, sweet scent of...box tape and fabreeze air fresheners. But really, the smell of success. Bonus points if you catch the faint whiff of adventure that comes from telling customers their units are most likely "the most secure in the business." The Secret Handshake (AKA, The Paperwork): You become a master at paperwork. While other people quiver at the sight of a lease, you look at it with the confidence of someone who‚Äôs been there, done that, and filled out every last signature. Your signature game? Stronger than a superhero‚Äôs.
cons: Your Car Will Never Look Clean Again: You know how some people take pride in keeping their car spotless? Well, prepare to abandon that dream. When you're constantly surrounded by boxes, bags, and "miscellaneous" items, your car will start looking like it was a part of a sale on "pre-owned vehicles." But hey, it's a good conversation starter. The "Tetris Master" You Never Asked to Be: You will become a Tetris god, and by "god," I mean someone who spends hours trying to figure out how to stack 15 couches, a dining room set, and a mattress the size of a small yacht into a unit that‚Äôs half the size of a football field. Your brain will be forever marked by the deep question: ‚ÄúWill this fit in a 10x10 unit?‚Äù The Endless Question: "What About The Temperature?" "Is this unit climate-controlled?" they ask. Of course it is, Karen. Sure, it‚Äôs the temperature of whatever nature says it is, but try not to bring it up every time a customer asks. The answer is always the same: Yes, we care about your stuff as much as you do. Now, please don‚Äôt ask me if your 87 pairs of boots will be fine. The Creepy Crawlies: Sometimes you will encounter the occasional uninvited guest. And by guest, I mean spiders. And by occasional, I mean several times a day. Do you know how hard it is to look professional when you‚Äôre fighting off a web that somehow attaches to your hair like it‚Äôs auditioning for a role in a heads and shoulders commercial? The Paper Trail of Doom: It's not that you don‚Äôt like filling out forms‚Äîokay, who are we kidding, you don‚Äôt. There‚Äôs always something that needs to be filled out: ID verification, rental agreements, damage reports, or a "So Sorry, Your Unit Is Missing, But We‚Äôll Help You Find It" form (that one's fun). It's like playing whack-a-mole, but instead of moles, it's stacks of paperwork.

title: I wish I had found Extra Space years ago!
pros: Some of the best reasons to work for ESS is the unity you feel as a company. everyone knows everyone, or you at least know their face. Usually people stay in their office all day, but a lot of senior management regular walks around. Even if they are not looking to talk, it feels nice to have them in your presence. Extra Space is helpful with everything and everyone's needs. If they cant help, they will find other ways to assist.
cons: Some of the cons of working for extra space are not even about the workplace it is more the location of the office building. I had to relocate to be a little closer to the home office. But it was no big deal.

title: overpaid janitor
pros:
flexible hours
decent pay
working alone

title: Growth and Opportunity
pros: I've been with the company for over four years and have drastically increased my pay. Started at the entry level store position and now I'm in line for my 3rd promotion to a salaried position. For those that work hard, the company is more than willing to recognize that and provide opportunity for growth. I love my team and gotten nothing but support from upper management.
cons: Split days off are a given at the field level but PTO accrual is aggressive. Not many holidays off, just the big 4, but they are all paid holidays.

title: So so
pros: Great health insurance, WFH, good training
cons: You won't make commission like they say you will unless you are really good at taking inbound calls. It will be a lot of calls. It's based on conversion. But they'll hire pretty much anyone who has experience on a phone.

title: Not professional in affairs
pros: Unfortunately, nothing to input here.
cons: Cold, managers that laughed at questions the untrained employees would ask.

title: Great place to work
pros: I have never worked for a better company before. The benefits alone are awesome even the suggestions that are taken from us and they are actually taken in consideration from the higher up is amazing as well.
cons: The only con that I hear about this company ever is the price increases that are not set to a certain rate, Personally I have never had an issue myself with the company, even when I had to be in the hospital for 10 days unexpectedly I never had to worry about my job being at risk.

title: For the Masochistic
pros: Consistent hours, Introductory property management experience, reasonable pay vs work completed.

title: Time has just FLOWN by!

title: Thriving Culture with Excellent Work Life Balance
pros: Positive and Rewarding Work Experience! Thriving Culture with Excellent Work Life Balance! I was in healthcare for over 20 years and making the decision to switch careers to Extra Space Storage was truly the best decision I have ever made! From beginning to end co workers and upper management have truly been a blessing!
cons: The only downfall I can say is the pay! Other than that scheduling along with incentives are pretty great!

title: A company who actually cares
pros: Since I made the decision to come to ESS as a District Manager I have been so happy with my decision and I am so grateful for the leadership and my peers. They have been patient with me and they genuinely want you to succeed. I have never worked with a company that from the top to your own peers and employees everyone wants to do a great job and they are always trying to find ways to make your life easier so you can do a better job.
cons: The only opportunity I have seen so far was with the initial training. It was a bit confusing and a little all over the place but they quickly realized that it was not working and have been actively working to fix it which is great!

title: AWESOME
pros: decent pay. Room for advancement.
cons: Haven't found any yet. But break ins can cause upset customers.

title: Work it
pros: The team in the distirct is great. There is always someone to talk to if you hit a snag in your daily job.The hours are good for the most part. No Sundays! I wish they had more relaxed poilcies about Saturdays off- only if you use your vacay time.
cons: Be prepared to run a facility by yourself. Although customers can rent online & skip over the office rental there is still a great deal of physical work to be done daily. Maintain the parking area, the bathrooms, the common areas. People think they have an onsite maid because they just drop anything on the floor & leave it. We have to clean units upon them moving out & if you are alone you will be called back to the office many times throughout the day to answer simple questions. "When is my rent due? " How much do I owe? It never ends. Oh yeah- why aren't you answering the phone- because I'm already on 2 lines of the phone ! Get the Google!

title: Current Employee
pros: -Accrue Emergency Time off as well as Paid Time Off -"Positive" work environment -Great insurance
cons: -Hard to speak your mind/be yourself because of the "Super Positive" work environment if you are having a bad day you cannot speak on it in your team chat. -Work burnout, some days will be back to back calls -Team Leads will assign you to certain teams/Job titles they have which gives you more work but will not pay you more money. (you are helping them do things they don't have time for) -If you are on Sales YOU WILL be stressed -Management is not all on the same page, you will hear different things from different Team Leads so make sure you do your own research on Call Center policy

title: Not the worst
pros: Good benefits except for their health plans. Good PTO, 401k, Etc. Decent work life balance except that you work every Saturday and 1 of your 2 days off is based off of someone else's religious preference. Lots of opportunity for advancement early on but that quickly changes after about 2-3 promotions.
cons: Very aggressive consumer practices that will make you question why "integrity" is one of their core values. It is a publicly traded company so this is just how the company operates now. Don't expect to be able to recommend Extra Space to family and friends in good faith once you understand how aggressive they are in using algorithms to raise rates and target customers that don't complain about the increases. Health plans aren't great and will cost you a lot down the line.

title: Great place to work
pros: Great work life balance and buy-in from management
cons: Cant think of any cons

title: Great start, unfortunate ending
pros: Employee Benefits, Paid Time Off
cons: Challenges include ineffective communication, inconsistent management practices, insufficient staffing coverage, and compensation that does not align with the workload and expectations for the week. Gossiping district management & District Team Leads, too much alone time to complete all task for one day on a busy week at a consistent clientele location

title: Needing Better Bonus Structure
pros: The help you get is amazing. From the training, to the teamwork.
cons: Never getting two days off in a row without PTO is not very fun. They do always say work/life balance but this does not reflect that. You end up getting burnt out quickly. Schedule is slow to come in so making necessary appointments is nearly impossible. After Merger, we are making in a YEAR with Extra Space (on average), what we were making what we made QUARTERLY with Life Storage. So the biggest advice I do have for ES, is a better bonus structure. Because we only bonus off of the amount of move ins. And that is out of our control to an extent. If 10 reviews a month are mandatory, make an incentive to get them. No bonus for merch sales anymore as well. Not enough paid time off. Another bad thing about the merger, we lost a lost of PTO. Personally I lost 60 hours because we only have very few paid holidays. We are open almost every day of the year which is also not Work/Life balance.

title: Not the Best Not the Worse Company to work for
pros: The fact I worked 18 years and had another full time job and I was part time and they gave me an opportunity it was appreciated. The 401k match is decent 100% of the first three percent (3%) of an employee's eligible compensation, and 50% of the next two percent (2%). Mileage Reimbursement. Great systems in place to communicate with customers and follow ups from stores you were at the previous day if you are at another store. They do have bonus opportunities even if you work at other stores you get credits for move ins and reviews. District Managers I interacted with were very professional and flexible but they have a heavy work load. They have decent insurance if your working full time.
cons: Think your working at one store absolutely not. Part-Time and Full Time employees associates or maintenance they have you run from store to store where other facilities are short 3-4 locations each week. By doing that you have no loyalty or responsibilities to adhere to because the employees jump from store to store. There is no loyalty almost impossible to retain customers and build relationships. So don't expect to be working at the same store unless you are the Manger of the Store If you work part time they expect you to work three 8hr shifts. Be expected to work Holidays. There is no company functions or outings or end of year holiday parties. Company relies on you heavily to deal with the customer if good bad and the ugly comes along break ins, upset customers. People love storage no matter what happens.

title: It‚Äôs OK- but not a growing career environment
pros: Set office hours 9:30-6pm, you get a 401k, decent benefits and they give you a uniform allowance every year. You also spend about half of your day working outside, not stuck at the desk all day long.
cons: They tell you to ‚Äútake ownership of your store‚Äù yet make you follow their exact guide lines through a sales process, they do ‚Äúmystery shops‚Äù that are inconsistent and you are graded on, you barely have any ground for a pay raise, they seem to push a growth culture but you are lucky if you get 1-2 promotions. Promotions beyond Store Manager title is based on favoritism.

title: Great Team Atmosphere and
pros: Extra Space provides a great work experience, being part of a team that supports and encourages one another. Provides comprehensive training and gives time to learn the process rather than leaving you to sink or swim. Work/Life Balance is great, home with my family at night and Sundays off every week. Competitive pay and ability to earn more with incentives and benefits.
cons: There are at times a lot of work over the phone, which can be a negative for some people.

title: An Exceptional Place to Grow and Thrive
pros: Supportive Leadership - The management team is approachable, transparent, and genuinely invested in employee success. They provide regular feedback, guidance, and ample opportunities for professional development. Collaborative Culture - The work environment fosters collaboration and teamwork. Team members are supportive, friendly, and always willing to lend a hand. The open communication channels make it easy to share ideas and innovate. Work-Life Balance - Extra Space values work-life balance and ensures that employees have the flexibility they need. The generous PTO policy and understanding of personal commitments make it easy to maintain a healthy balance. Career Growth Opportunities - There are numerous opportunities for career advancement. Extra Space offers regular training and mentorship programs. Internal promotions are common, and hard work is consistently recognized and rewarded. Comprehensive Benefits - The benefits package includes competitive salaries, health insurance, retirement plans, and other perks like wellness programs and employee discounts. Inclusive Environment - Diversity and inclusion are at the heart of Extra Space's culture. The company actively promotes a welcoming and inclusive environment where everyone feels valued and respected.
cons: Honestly, I can't think of any significant cons. Like any workplace, there are occasional challenges, but the pros far outweigh them.

title: Good Job, just know what to expect
pros: Its an amazing job if you enjoy human interaction. Properly dealing with your customers is top priority. You also have to understand how to both work independently and as a team within your district.
cons: My only issue is that I feel I need more training at my position rather than learn on the fly

title: Great Place To Work
pros: I like working at Extra Space Storage because every day is different and I am not stressed out to come to work. Its a job comprised of many small easy tasks that do take a little time to learn but I'm glad I did. There is a good sense of freedom and teamwork at the same time. I appreciate having Sundays off and customer can tell that I am happy at my job.
cons: It takes about a year to feel comfortable working at this job without any help.

title: Change of pace at ESS
pros: After 33 years of big box, brick & mortar and unique gifts shops, I have found ESS Extra special. I wanted a job going into retirement that I could go home and relax, not spend 20 minutes venting to my husband. Everyone I have met is friendly, considerate and always genuinely willing to help. I can't remember when or if ever I have felt that way at work.
cons: There is always something to do at ESS. I haven't really found anything that I would say it a con yet. Sure it gets slow and quiet, but most people just like seeing a smiling face with a wave when they come in to access their unit.

title: I wish I had found Extra Space years ago!
pros: The pay is great, you get paid time off, you work with wonderful group of people, you build your communication skills, you learn how to handle difficult situations, and you work in a clean/well kept environment.
cons: You have to commute to multiple work sites throughout the week, you sometimes have to have difficult conversations with tenants, and you may find yourself with more tasks than you can handle at one time.

title: Hostile work environment
pros: Working full time Sundays off
cons: The workplace is disorganized and lacks accessible support. Training is confusing and overly complex, making it difficult to understand. Shifts are long with heavy workloads that must be completed in a short time, often without assistance. Supervisors are unwilling to provide help, and cleaning must be done despite insufficient supplies. The environment is stressful and hostile, with unrealistic goals that are nearly impossible to meet. There is no paid sick time, very limited PTO that is difficult to use, and employees are required to work outside regular business hours.

title: I have been working with Extra Space for two years
pros: Always and I mean Always a positive and family friendly atmosphere in the office and management. I feel important when coming to work and I have a supportive management team as well. There is always room to grow and it's overall a great place to grow. Opportunity to learn new skills.

The work schedule for Extra Space is a cut above the rest in this industry - in at 9:30 am, Sundays & evenings off, Thanksgiving, Christmas & New Years off, Extra Space also values & rewards employees for excellence - my trajectory in the two years I've been with the company is on a great path! I look forward to continued growth and forward motion with Extra Space.
