title: At Extra Space Storage, I'm valued as an employee and a person.
pros: I love working at Extra Space because the employees treat me like family, and I'm valued as an employee and a person. The management is very supportive and invested in your work-life balance. Everyone, including upper management, is approachable and open to hearing your feedback regarding the company, whether good or bad. My manager is fantastic and always willing to help, no matter the reason. I am fortunate to work remotely, and they are very flexible with my work hours, which is great!
cons: I don't have any downsides to mention. This job is great for me because I work remotely. While I'm not interested in advancing my position, I believe that if you want to grow with the company and advance in your role, it's easier and probably faster if you live in Utah and work at Extra Space's home office.

title: Never got a chance
pros: Online None None None None
cons: Not a chance for a interview

title: Best Company Culture
pros: I have worked at 10 different companies in my lifetime. Extra Space is by far my favorite. The people and overall culture are amazing. My superiors are great and care about me as a person rather than as just an employee. Same goes for lots of other teams I've heard about and observed. It's also a very stable company with promising opportunities for growth in the future.
cons: The benefits are not as great as other companies I've worked for. The current insurance providers are difficult to work with. Cost for the employee is also higher than other places I've worked. Overall the benefits will cover the needs for you and your family, but it might cost more and be more of a headache than other insurance plans.

title: Great place to work
pros: Great Company to work for. You are respected and can voice opinions with no judgement. Upper management actually listens to what you have to say. You are set up for success and there is support throughout the district whenever necessary. I truly feel valued and an important part of a team.
cons: When we are short staffed, you tend to work alone at times until we find applicants to hire. It is generally a temporary situation.

title: Extra Space offers you a place to grow and call home.
pros: Excellent detailed training to get started on the right foot. Offers the ability to work independently and as part of team. Holds work-life balance as one their core values. Reliable schedule flexibility, generous performance based bonuses. Support from upper management
cons: Need to able to manage downtime and keep disciplined to complete all recommended best practices

title: Could Improve in Areas
pros: Set hours, Ability to plan our your own day around customer needs.
cons: Loudest voices always seem to be underlings given the least important tasks. Can't get two days off in a row on a consistent basis because of low quality of floating managers. Being more productive seems to backfire. Veterans who can handle their store solo aren't compensated for the extra work they do when their coverage is consistently pulled elsewhere.

title: Decent company

title: Great Culture where Core values are lived out, top to bottom!
pros: I‚Äôve been working as a District Manager at Extra Space Storage for nearly 5 years. I can honestly say that it has been an incredible journey. I keep waiting for the dream to end. Here are some highlights: Supportive Leadership: The management team genuinely cares about employee growth and development. They provide regular feedback, mentorship, and opportunities for advancement. Collaborative Environment: The collaborative culture at Extra Space fosters teamwork and creativity. I‚Äôve had the chance to work with talented colleagues who share a passion for excellence. Impactful Work: As a District Manager, I‚Äôve been able to make a real impact on the success of our stores. Whether it‚Äôs improving sales, optimizing processes, or enhancing customer experiences, my role feels meaningful. Work-Life Balance: Extra Space Storage values work-life balance. They understand the importance of maintaining a healthy equilibrium, which contributes to overall job satisfaction. Recognition and Rewards: The company recognizes hard work and celebrates achievements. From bonuses to employee appreciation events, they make sure employees feel valued. Overall, my experience as a District Manager at Extra Space Storage has been outstanding. I highly recommend this organization to anyone seeking a supportive, growth-oriented environment.
cons: You have to be comfortable with change. If you are not or are fixed minded, this is not a good role for you.

title: Terrible at Communication
pros: Depending on where you work, you tend to have a lot of downtime on your hands, which you can use to work a second job (virtually) and get paid twice over for the same time. There is a very low bar for excellence which focuses on number manipulation, so if you're good at that and it doesn't bother your conscience, then you can move up quickly in this company.
cons: This company has a few major issues which will always hold it back. The 1st is how poorly they communicate within their own operations. Changes get made and they never inform the store at the store level until 1-2 months after they did it. Everyone is different, but many of the DTL's and DM's in numerous districts tend to gatekeep information, which hurts their team. The other major issue is that their values are too numerous and all over the place. They have 17 different values which are often times in conflict with each other on any given day, but everything is always important. And lastly, their focus on numbers and nothing else breeds a certain kind of person that learns to manipulate the numbers to show them as a great employee when they're not even a good person. Turning away customers just because they're not going to get the CPP/merch/easypay and upsetting them enough to leave a 1 star review on Google, still keeps your store's numbers looking good and your review interaction high (despite the rating). That's the absolute wrong focus to incentivize on and it's no wonder why customers are always looking to rent somewhere else.

title: Great work/ Life Balance
pros: Upper Management is great. Very cohesive team. We all work together to achieve great District KPI. Benefits keep getting better each year,
cons: If you work at a slower site, you can get quite bored at times, but it's all about finding the little things to do and finding ways to help others so you don't lose your mind. Wish we were paid Holiday pay for holidays we have to work on top of our 40 hr/ week.

title: So far so good!
pros: Depending on your location and what type of facility you are running, the pay is decent. I think that the ones who work in an outdoor facility need to make a little more than those who run an indoor facility due to the increase in manual labor for the upkeep of the facility. Sundays off is a big perk for me. I like having a weekend day off for family, friends, or life balance. After working over 20 years in traditional retail, this is a nice balance between customer service and facility upkeep. I like that any mileage you accure by traveling to other locations is directly entered into your timecard. I've worked for other companies and the worst one didn't pay your mileage for almost 3 weeks. There's efficiency in their infrastructure here. Communication between my trainer, other co workers, and direct supervisors has be friendly and helpful-no drama so far! Most of the software has a good help system, so if you prefer to learn on your own you can. I like that there feels like there's a infrastructure that is built with the company that promotes a good work experience for staff.
cons: The training focuses a little too much on the selling and less on site upkeep, which can be overwhelming when you're finally on your own and don't know how to do things. Pay could be better with the way cost of living has increased. Pay for out door unit workers should be more than indoors due to the increased labor. The website really should promote that the sales on the units are temporary so that customers aren't suprised when rates increase after. All corporate storage facilities have the same practices, but the lack of transparency to the customer makes retaining clients difficult. Customers wish we had longer lease options rather month to month, but I understand why we don't. Depending on how far you want to go, there might not be promotions available to you if you don't relocate. Ive heard the insurance isn't the best

title: Wonderful place to work.
pros: What can i say there are so many. We are off on Sundays, we get a lot of holidays off. The work life balance is amazing. The company cares about the well being of their employees but all the business side of it as well. The benefits are really good. The culture is what keeps me here. I would recommend this company to anybody that wants to work.

pros: I love the culture of teamwork and excellence at Extra Space. I love the work/life balance. I'm managing an entire site of 780 units, being expected to come in after hours if there is an emergency, and handling all the operations and not even making $22 per hour. The lack of a livable wage is essentially the only negative in this position. This of course results in a high turnover rate.

title: Fantastic Place To Work

cons: Have to work sites alone many times per week.

title: "Great People, Poor Leadership, and Unsustainable Growth"
pros: The employees at Extra Space Storage are truly exceptional. They are dedicated, hardworking, and some of the best colleagues you could hope to meet. Their passion and commitment to their work are what keep the company moving forward, often going above and beyond to meet expectations despite challenging circumstances. The team spirit and camaraderie are what make working here feel special, and it's their tireless efforts that drive the company‚Äôs success.
cons: While Extra Space Storage may seem like an appealing company on the surface, it's one to approach with caution. The rapid growth hasn't been matched with proper scaling, leaving the company stretched thin. Leadership operates with a small-business mindset, continually applying growth strategies that are unsustainable at the current scale. The employees are truly incredible, some of the best people you could hope to work with. However, this creates a false sense of culture that masks deeper issues. Beneath the surface, there's a company culture that leans heavily on personal relationships, which can feel like manipulation to keep up appearances Upper management operates like a "cool kids' club." If you're not part of their inner circle, your voice simply won't be heard, no matter how much data or how many well-thought-out recommendations you bring forward. They're out of touch with the real work needed to support their ever-growing initiatives and dismiss the concerns of mid-management about morale and workload. Burnout is seen as a weakness rather than a signal of an overloaded system, with management implying that those affected simply don't work hard enough.

title: Best Job I've Ever Had
pros: *Hours* I love that our hours allow for me to drop by daughter off at school, and that the offices are never open on Sundays. I even like having a day off during the week, because it gives me the chance to schedule important appointments without interrupting my work hours. *Culture* Extra Space has a great work culture, mostly due to all the passionate people that are constantly working towards excellence every single day. Every time I have asked for assistance, someone has always been there to help me. *Mix of Inside and Outside Work* Most days I actually love that I get to get my steps in checking units and maintaining the property. While also being lucky enough to get to sit in an office to make delinquency calls and answer emails
cons: *Hard Conversations* As in any customer service role, hard conversations will always be a part of the job. What makes them easier to have here is that Extra Space really does everything they can to help and support its employees through the tough situations that occur when hard conversations are needed. *Mix of Inside and Outside work* I like the wide variety of responsibilities that come with this job, but that may not be everyone's cup of tea.

title: It was OK
pros: Pros were the hours and some of the staff members
cons: Cons are having to do everything! From maintenance to admin. If there is a flood be prepared to vacuum water or mop up water by hand. And if you‚Äôre working alone be prepared to vacuum water while answering phones, doing tours and renting units. Some sites just run with 2 employees so if someone is off or calls out all the workload is on you. Also, management does not care about rodents or having a safe working environment. My site had a huge RAT infestation and nothing was done about it. Management ordered rat traps and expected us to put them out. Not worth the pay or the headaches

pros: This company cares about all their employee's, I know 1st hand. Holiday's off ++

cons: The pay and unable to do anything around the schedule 930- 600, and having to work Saturdays ALWAYS, sucks!

title: Employee Experiance

title: Great Company

cons: More money for company shoes and include pants in uniform platform; Larger bonus/incentives for people who have been with the company for 5, 10, 15, 20+ years (example: 5 years $5K bonus; 10 years 10K bonus, etc.)

title: Awesome Company
pros: I have worked in retail and food service and this is the first company that has made me feel like family. It feels weird for a company to actually put family first and the job second. This is by far the best company I have worked for and have no desire to leave.
cons: I honestly have no cons, I come to work everyday and genuinely enjoy what I do and who I work for.

title: Great Company
pros: The culture is a big pro. Many companies talk about being culturally driven and investing in the first customer which is the employee, Extra Space loves it from the top of the organization on down.
cons: Only con for me is I wish I joined the organization a lot sooner.

title: The BEST Work Environment!!
pros: PTO and healthcare benefits, yearly raises and monthly incentive bonus, flexible scheduling, entry level(no sales experience required), friendly and comfortable work environment, just showing up is half the job.
cons: Dealing with certain customers in a sales position, performance is based off of metrics, could pay a little more, have to work Saturday, work uniform attire.

title: Greatest Workplace on Earth!!!
pros: I am going share a quote I read not too long ago that really describes this company it's culture; "It's not WHERE you work, it's WHO you work with that makes a job worth going to every day!" And this is correct; it's the people that make this job and company what it is!!! They are the Best; Top to bottom!!! Love it!!!
cons: I have not a bad thing to say!!!

title: Great Company
pros: Great work/life balance. This company actually cares about their employees and provides different programs to help their employees through rough times. Great benefits. Monthly bonuses. This company always hires within and you can move up in the company quickly.
cons: Dealing with customers who get outrageous rent increases.

title: Best Employer Ever
pros: Extra Space Storage has been my employer for 11 years. Opportunity to participate in roundtable discussions with CEO and upper management as well as department heads. I have been given all the training, tools, & ongoing coaching and support to get the best results increasing my bonus potential. Rewards me for meeting and exceeding goals set daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly. Opportunity for advancement throughout the company is encouraged and supported. Genuinely cares about me as an employee. Offers employee assistance for health and financial concerns, just to name a few.
cons: Shift bids every quarter meaning you may have a change of shifts you work every 3 months. Based on seniority and performance

title: They make so much money and don't pay well
pros: Sundays off and off by 6
cons: They keep people that keep making everything worse rises are a joke

title: District manager
pros: Acquisitions and managing new development properties was the highlight.
cons: Management is evolving in a very micromanaging way

title: Integrity and Transparency?
pros: Very team oriented and they want to be portrayed as a company who cares for their employees, which they do for the most part. Closed on Sundays. Want a good work/life balance and believe in family first.
cons: Not everything is sunshine and roses, especially if you don't think their way of operating is the best way to do business. They say they want your suggestions, but then feel you're being negative by bringing up those suggestions. So, be careful how you voice your opinions. They also say to live by their compass where Integrity & Transparency are a part of everyday life. They are not open and transparent to their customers as they should be.

title: Best Company for Growth
pros: Extra Space is one of the best company to work for and for growth opportunities. They really want you to be successful and they provide the extra training to help you be successful. They have an amazing mentor program where they pair agents with a mentor to work one on one to help agents hit their goals and to be successful within the company. They truly care about their Employees and want everyone to succeed. They have amazing benefits and not only do they have PTO (Paid Time Off) they also give you ETO as well. (Emergency Time Off)
cons: There are no cons that I can think of

title: Best Job Ever!
pros: Extra Space Storage provides a family type atmosphere and we are very customer focused. We do everything we can to help our customers and to make it a stellar experience for them pay is good and our teams are great!
cons: every company has cons exra space cons are so trivial no need to mention

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Teamwork and support have been an essential part of my experience working for Extra Space Storage.
cons: Hours of operation, but it's understandable when it comes to accommodating the customers needs. And the company works with your scheduling to fit your lifestyle.

title: Great company!
pros: Work life balance Flexible schedule Easy job Benefits
cons: None to really say honestly. No company is perfect, but this job has been my best experience

title: Great Company for Growth, Could Improve Benefit
pros: I‚Äôve had a positive experience working at Extra Space Storage. The company truly values employee development and goes above and beyond to provide growth opportunities. There is a strong culture of listening to employee feedback, and leadership takes the time to understand and address concerns. This has made for a collaborative and engaging work environment.
cons: One area where the company could improve is in its benefits and healthcare offerings. While the current package is decent, enhancing the benefits and providing more comprehensive healthcare options would make a big difference for employees.

title: Awesome Culture & Company
pros: We have an exceptional leadership team at every level. Our executives and leaders genuinely care about the well-being of our employees. We offer a strong work/life balance, along with excellent benefits. Additionally, there are fantastic growth opportunities across various departments within the company.
cons: None that I can think of.

title: Striving for Excellence
pros: This company strives to elevate employees using coach and council development skills with programs for free training, example QuickHelp
cons: Sometimes we can be short staffed and have to alter job sites on short notice

title: Great Place to Work & Opportunity to Grow
pros: The company is a great place to work, They provide a lot of opportunities internally. The work hours and work life balance is great . Love the company's values, brand image and what they stand for. PTO and benefits are provided as well.
cons: Can't really find any cons except this position wouldn't be for a person who is not willing or open to cleaning and maintaining a facility

title: Awesome Culture
pros: Work/life balance. Empowered to make decisions. Support Stability
cons: It can be tough to deal with guests that make poor decisions and can't bring accounts current. But we are clear about what they can expect.

title: Great place to work!!!
pros: I have been with Extra Space for 25 years !! They treat their employees like family! It truly is an exceptional place to work!!
cons: More holidays off would be nice

title: Outstanding Culture Driven Company
pros: 1. Supportive Work Environment: ESS values its employees to create a supportive and inclusive work environment where individuals feel appreciated and respected. 2. Career Growth: Employees have the opportunity for professional development and career advancement within the company, allowing them to grow and reach their full potential. 3. Employee Well-being: ESS prioritizes employee well-being by offering benefits, wellness programs, and work-life balance initiatives, leading to a healthier and happier workforce. 4. Meaningful Work: Employees may have the chance to make a positive impact on the lives of others and contribute to something meaningful, which can provide a sense of fulfillment in their work. 5. Learning Opportunities: The company provides various learning and training opportunities, which can enhance employees' skills and knowledge and keep them engaged and challenged in their roles. 6. Positive Impact: Working for a company that can transform lives with its opportunities allows employees to be part of something bigger, making a positive impact on individuals and communities.
cons: I have nothing but positive things to say about this company.

title: Remote Job, Low Pay for Hard Work
pros: Work remotely (and the ability to swap your assigned shift if you can find someone willing to). Most of the people I work with are cool. I get time off the phone for a few hours a week for Self-development or to meet with peers and management on camera. I stay connected and interact with everyone all day via TEAMS.
cons: Compensation is way too low! Extra Space is a multi-billion dollar company that averages thousands per rental, yet you'll only see a few dollars of commission for that if you perform at the "floor average." The attendance policy is very strict and the little PTO you have is often denied when you try to schedule it. Our pay is affected by things out of our control, such as Solicitors, Robots, and SERVICE calls that come through to our sales lines. Management tries to tell us that "it all evens out because everyone else on the sales floor gets service calls too." Okay, but there's also a reason why Service reps get paid a higher hourly rate to take Service calls, so we should also be paid accordingly for those, and not get docked AT ALL for other non-sales calls (which automatically count against our sales numbers/ commission).

title: Great place to work
pros: Great support from my district manager. You can call any store and they have all been very helpful in finding information and answers to questions. The culture is very relaxed and supportive.
cons: The hours are 9-6 and your days off are Sunday and another day during the week. Days off not together.

title: Decent job
pros: Good work life balance and co workers
cons: Pay is too low for the amount of things required to do

title: 4/5 stores
pros: love my job, this company cares about the employees and the company is always growing which means new opportunities
cons: no complaints about the company

title: Incredible Company and Culture
pros: Our people and our culture. As the organization grows in size, we've been able to successfully maintain a fantastic culture that is driven by leadership and our teams. It's a joint effort and everyone contributes to making this company a great place to work. Work-life balance for a District Manager is very good considering the role. It is a longer work week for many DM's but most put in the effort as they want to well versus being told that they have to do well. There's a big difference. Room for career advancement if someone chooses. You will be the biggest determining factor with your career path.
cons: In thinking hard about this, as there aren't too many cons, there is a bit of tedious work that is involved. However, that's going to be part of any job responsibilities. There's a lot going on that will challenge you and keep you engaged.

title: Lots to do
pros: Building relationships with tenants. Getting to walk a lot. It is a hybrid between an office job with a heavy sales focus, with the other side of it can be a lot of walking around and projects on the property.
cons: There can be break ins, picking up bodily fluids, cleaning the only bathroom, delinquency calls. Some DM's want three calls per delinquent customer a week. Some properties can have 50 people behind on payment. Having to go through the auction process and dealing with sensitive process with people who can't scrounge up money for their unit that goes to auction. It is hard to get any raise or promoted. Working other stores for the first time, you will just get a binder of how to hopefully function properly. Working alone often. You might be on the property trying to finish a task that could take you 30 minutes, but take all day due to people showing up to the office and calling you to come back.

title: On property or at the National Service Center - AWESOME!!
pros: I have had the best leadership at this company; matching any other Fortune 500 company I have worked for.
cons: Working on property will be the most responsibility you will have ever had! It will prepare you for the next great thing you do in your career. Working at the National Service Center (call center) will definitely improve your communication skills and teach you how to best assist a customer.

title: Great place to work
pros: Stable employment with great growth opportunities.
cons: It is a large corporation so there is a bit of politicking.

title: Great Work/Life Balance
pros: Great work hours, Family oriented, Flexible schedule, Diverse, Compensation and benefits.

title: Extra Space culture is unmatchable

cons: I have no cons for Extra Space.

title: Best Job Ever!
pros: Extra Space Storage provides a family type atmosphere and we are very customer focused. We do everything we can to help our customers and to make it a stellar experience for them. Pay is good and our Teams are great!

title: 7 Years of Amazing Service

title: excellent work environment

title: Don't do it
pros: Some really nice tenants at times that make your day a little brighter.
cons: Mystery shops ridiculous. Meeting metrics and demands impossible. First raise was 8 cents. Poor pay. Tenants get angry, pee and poop all over property, mice, floods, cleaning all the time, trying to sell at the same time, getting yelled at if you do not perform 100% for a mystery shop, not getting enough time off, poor benefits, running to the bank 3x a week, always being alone in a HUGE facility and expected to sell, clean, run to the bank and take care of everything and get paid peanuts. Favoritism. Narcissistic business practices. Gaslighting management. Sex in the bathrooms, vandalism, people damaging the doors, the property, the bathroom and a lot of disrespect. Assistant managers get treated like third class citizens and do the same thing as the managers. No opportunity to move up, too many employees, too few upper positions.

title: Great Culture and Work / Life Balance
pros: ESS has a great culture and truly cares for its team members. There are growth and advancement opportunities, and many resources available to grow and develop. There is a strong Team atmosphere, including meetings, conferences, overall support, and extracurricular events such as charity work and team building. The work life balance is also a huge advantage. Overall, my peers and supervisors provide an amazing environment of sharing, learning, and support. I have the guidance, direction, yet autonomy to do my job, and all the support possible to be successful.
cons: Would like to see more federal holidays added, as well as sick days added on top of PTO / vacation time. Bonuses and pay are solid, of course, they can always be improved and additions.

pros: Amazing company with management that TRULY cares from the top to the bottom. It is a place of empowerment and they stick to the compass that leads the company to success. ESS provides resources to their employees that are going through hard times. They pay is good. Growth is always an opportunity should you choose to make this a career. I could go on and on about why Extra Space Storage is a great company to work for.
cons: My only complaint is the working hours at M-F 9:30am - 6pm and Saturday 9am - 5:30pm. If you have younger children these hours are difficult and you missing a lot of extra curricular events and eat late dinners. There are so many other ways customers can complete rentals that this just does not make sense when work/life balance is preached so much.

title: Best Place I Ever Worked

title: Not as great as I thought
pros: insurance, sundays off, some of the employees you work with are good people getting screwed just as you are.
cons: Thought it was going to be ok, but what is sad is that they merged a company with them, and its been just a few days shy of being 3 months, and have yet to put those employees to what Extra Space employees make the merged employees are being told to wait till the end of the year! but are hiring new people and putting them at the Extra Space pay rate. This is not fair. You do not get Saturday's unless you use your hard earned PTO time. It's Mandatory that you work Saturday's and Monday's unless you use PTO time and its granted. You get one specific day off a week and Sunday's. The DTL of the area can change their day off anytime they want including Saturday's and Monday's even when the rest of the team was told those days were mandatory to work. There is NO work/life balance only a work life, you will not see your family. Work maybe a little easy with just one person, but having double coverage even for a slow property is good to have as then the store manager would not be burnt out.

Extra Space gives us procedures and guidelines to make certain tasks a smoother transition. Some DM's choose not to follow certain procedures and or guidelines and it makes our jobs more difficult. It also tells me that some DM's don't care about my customer's nor my store. They only care about their bonus at the end of the year. If my DM don't care why should I?

title: 0/10 - Would not recommend

cons: Let me count the ways... Store employees are just a number to the company. As a store employee, your thoughts/ideas are not valued, hardly even discussed. MLM is arrogant and doesn't take into account Store Employees actual experience with the customers/property. They promote Work/Life Balance, but it isn't a thing. You'll get called at all hours of the day for things the 24 hour customer care phone team should be able to take care of or at least deescalate until the next business day. Work schedules are released the day before the work week. Your direct supervisor is a rare sight to see or even receive a reply from. It's not explained, to customers who rent online, that their rent will be raised by 30-100%(most cases) within less than a handful of months.

pros: They have great cultural.Management and Leads are so great at making sure you know you are a part of a team. Loved my coworkers. You have all the support you want and need.
cons: Rate increases. These are one of the hardest things to inform a customer. And when they have their storage unit auctioned. They do not realize this has happened.

title: Finally Found a Job That I Love
pros: No nights or Sundays Excellent leadership Realistic goals Great work/life balance
cons: No stock plan for field workers Poor communication Salary could be a lot better No overtime allowed

title: Caring Management
pros: My managers and HR actually care. I was sick last year and in and out of the hospital for between 3 & 4 months. They kept my store managers position the whole time. I stepped down to assistant manager at w my request while healing. When I let them know my health was back up enough to run a store again, my manager had gotten me a brand new store to manage within only a couple of weeks.
cons: Some of the metrics we are judged by require systems that sometimes do not work. Getting credit for every review.... I have seen many times that I get a legitimate review but never see credit for it. The phone drops calls often when you are out on prorperty.

title: Great opportunities
pros: Paid mileage, great PTO, incentive bonus, great training, traveling experience, plenty to add to a resume
cons: No paid sick time, if you are sick you have to use PTO. I hate working alone.

title: work place

title: Great Culture...Great Work/Life Balance
pros: Extra Space promotes an excellent culture and lives it everyday. This is not just a sign on the wall. They truly live by what they say. You don't find this often with large companies these days. Work/life balance is also a huge plus. Stores are typically closed by 6:00pm which means very little off hours work from home and weekends are also not required. Excellent place to work.
cons: If I had one gripe about this employer it might be the benefits. Don't get me wrong, the health insurance is very good but out of pocket expenses have been higher than what my previous employers were. This may just be a sign of the times and a small gripe at that.

title: Good company
pros: They do a good job of trying to ensure you have a good work/life balance. The job is fairly easy.
cons: The pay isn't fantastic. They need to do a better job with tracking of sales to ensure proper credit is given considering how little we're paid. Burnout is R-E-A-L.

title: Great place to work!

title: Love my job

title: Great Career Opportunities & Team
pros: Working at Extra Space Storage has been a highly positive experience. The supportive and inclusive culture creates an enjoyable and fulfilling work environment. Leadership is genuinely invested in our professional growth, providing ample opportunities for career advancement. The collaborative atmosphere encourages creativity and effective teamwork, allowing us to tackle challenges together and celebrate our successes. Overall, Extra Space Storage is a fantastic place to work, with a strong focus on both personal and professional development, making it an ideal environment for thriving and achieving career goals.
cons: Work-life balance can be difficult.

title: Great company - favoritism appears at times
pros: Excellent opportunities to grow. Very easy job overall. Stick to your job checklist and you will have no problems. If you like being by yourself, which I do, it is great! Diversity as a company is great, and welcoming. You work 8 hours a day, unless something crazy happens, that is it. No over working like retail jobs. Major holidays are paid, and Sundays off.
cons: There is favoritism within your own team, where managers prefer certain assistance, trainers prefer certain managers, and DM with all of the above. Recognizing managers they are good at, but only if you hit all goals. Even if you knock your numbers out of the park from the previous month, you can miss one goal by .1 and you will not get any shout out, ect. Diversity as a district, not so much. You can easily see where there is not in certain groups of managers. Or where people do not get hired by their colorful body art. Though you can express yourself with tattoos if appropriate, you can not with piercings or hair color.

title: Corporate greed

cons: Low pay, very low opportunity for advancement, you work some holidays, they now make you pay rent for the apartment but you don‚Äôt get the luxury of privacy of a paid living space.

title: Best place to work in Utah

There is good work/life balance but still feel like I'm challenged and contributing toward the company goals
cons: Benefits are lacking compared to some of the silicon slopes companies.

cons: as a Assistant Manager you float between stores, so one day you could be 5 minutes from home the next 30 mins plus. you almost always work alone, so you got to be really good with doing multiple jobs at one time. title: Great work place

title: This isn't just a Job it's an adventure

It's a place where you can learn and grow where if you feel like your voice is really being heard and upper management really care. At Extra Space family really does come first between the hours you work and time you have to spend with your family it truly is a balance. Family emergency, they put our loved ones first. Being a manager for many years in the Hospitality industry I can really say that I would recommend Extra Space to everyone working here has changed my view on what a Job really is.

title: 11 years together and still in love with ESS!
pros: ‚Ä¢ Since starting at ESS, I have learned: That I am the one in control of my future with this company - if I want something, I have to ask for it, earn it and keep it! ‚Ä¢ I enjoy working at ESS because: I feel valued by my immediate supervisor; I feel heard having been given an ability to submit feedback to various departments within the company; I feel appreciated by the thank you's I receive from my team. ‚Ä¢ A day in the life of an ESS employee includes: Helping people (customers); managing a storage facility; learn new things; have fun with co-workers; feel accomplished at the end of the day. ‚Ä¢ At work, I am looking forward to: Helping people be the best them and have the best day! ‚Ä¢ ESS makes my work life easier by: Giving me an easy way to communicate. ‚Ä¢ I am proud to work at ESS because: We are innovative and trying to keep adaptable to what our customers and employees need - to simply be the best we can be.
cons: ‚Ä¢ For the fairly complex and hard work we do, I feel the pay should be higher. ‚Ä¢ Training could be better. There are so many policies, best practices, procedures and processes that we are expected to follow and adhere to. It can be a lot. Providing more thorough and on-going training would allow consistency across the nation, rather than only within a single district or team.

title: Stressful

cons: Manager above DM never came through on promises to give site the proper tool needed to help run it efficiently High turnovers You don‚Äôt get paid enough for what you have to deal with, because your not only a salesman, your a referee, therapist, janitor, maintenance worker, and a detective Demanding sales goals to meet Even though I did great with my ratings on shops, there were way too many that came in and wasted my time when I was the only manager on site and took me away from a REAL customer They started tracking how many times their facilities answered incoming calls and we were expected to answer each call, even when we were single staffed trying to run the facility to its fullest capacity. It came off to me as being micromanaged and lack of trust in employees fulfilling their responsibilities Just a lot of overall unnecessary pressure to rent an empty box Corporate Management implemented policies for field management that looked good on paper, but made it harder to do our jobs out in the field After the pandemic, ESS expected us to justify $80+ rate increases to customers, when ESS corporate are the ones that implemented this to automatically change in there account system in the first place, so yes the customers were not happy Pay range is on the lower end and does not accommodate the cost of living in the more expensive cities to live in

title: Fantastic Company With Down To Earth Ideals
pros: My company merged with Extra Space Storage one year ago today! Initially, there was a lot of natural apprehension. We were a smaller regional company and feared we would be lost in the crowd after the merger. My experience has been nearly 100% positive, and one year on, I'm so happy that the joining of our two brands happened. From the CEO, Executives, and Senior Management down to the store managers and call center agents, I felt welcomed, included and respected from day one. The values and principles Extra Space asks its employees to live by every day are simple and down to earth. As a member of the LGBTQ+ community, it's refreshing that they support me and the ideals I live by.
cons: Nothing is perfect, and Extra Space is outstanding at recognizing this and striving to improve. That's the sign of a great company with even more outstanding leadership, not hiding from a problem but addressing it and working to make changes. My only specific "con" is that the company remains large, and you lose a little intimacy of a smaller company. The wheels of change can move a little slower than you'd like.

New hires are getting paid more than more senior managers. Changes are implemented constantly with basically no advance notice and not enough info or training, You can grow within the company, as long as you follow leadership blindly and do not question anything, Until you get a higher management position, pay will continue to be mediocre, yet you will have increased responsibilities.

Working at Extra Space has been a great experience; tools and knowledges are available to everybody. It is a challenge sometimes, but we always get someone to help us. Professional teammates, friendly and respectful. It is a nice environment to work, good benefits. Growth opportunities.
cons: A lot to clean!. If you are not willing to this aspect, this is not the place to work on.

title: On-site vs remote
pros: I really enjoyed working on site as a store manager. It wasn't just about metrics and you could break up your day with different tasks
cons: Working as a sales agent remotely was absolutely terrible. The commission structure is a joke and all they focus on is metrics. If you don't meet certain sales numbers, you'll never make a decent amount on commission and you'll never get a good schedule during shift bids.

pros: I've been in in executive levels at many companies. I've liked many of them. To say that Extra Space has an amazing culture would cheapen this experience. I've not ever been a part of or even read about a culture as outstanding as this. Be careful not to be skeptical of the outstanding reviews here. After being here for a little over a year now, meeting peers, superiors, executives and observed the treatment of people, my only regret is not starting sooner with ESS.
cons: There's just not much to say here. It really is that good.

Raises are mediocre. Never enough staffing. Rent increases and pricing is outrageous and we're taught to gaslight customers into thinking they're getting the best price. Employee benefits are being taken away or reduced.

title: Great company to work for

title: Don't settle!
pros: Working at Extra Space has been a rewarding experience filled with learning and professional growth. The collaborative culture is highly valued with open communication make for a positive working environment. There are ample opportunities for career advancement and with various trainings offered, Extra Space helps employees grow professionally.
cons: Despite some challenges with workload that could be overwhelming, the pros outweigh the cons, making it a great place for those looking to advance their leadership skills.

title: It's not the worst
pros: Schedule is pretty consistent, and you have a fair amount of autonomy since upper management isn't physically there most of the time (store managers technically don't have any authority over assistant managers). Also the job is pretty easy once you learn all of the policies and get the sales process down. It's not hard but there can be a lot to do especially if you're at a busy location (you're a receptionist, retail manager, sales person, janitor, and facility manager all at once). If you consistently keep up with everything though you can have a lot of free time which is nice.
cons: Pay is not good for the amount of responsibility you have (I'm getting paid just under $20/hr as an SM) and any bonuses are heavily taxed. There is definitely a gap between what different genders get paid. They also expect you to keep your wages a secret even though it's literally illegal to enforce that. Little to no overtime available. They may have you work at different stores (especially if you're an assistant manager) so it can be a long commute. Also be prepared to work alone most of the time because there's a high turnover rate and staffing is limited. They also expect you to get 10 google reviews a month which is a hassle You'll also be expected to help out other stores in your district, which is okay but "helping" often turns into doing someone else's work for them & cleaning up after them with little to no reward. Also unsurprisingly... with it being a customer service position, obviously it can be challenging dealing with customers who have little to no regard for you as a human being.

title: Always changing schedules/DTL Stinks
pros: Good corporate company. Corporate cares about you.
cons: Every week in our district they change schedules, are late with schedules, and schedule like a checkerboard. Hardly work in home store. For example Joe works at facility 1, tom works at facility 2. Joe is scheduled to work at facility 2 while tom has to work at facility 1, make that make sense. We are not treated as teams only individuals. AM's are treated as maint people and not given any credit when stores do good, only when stores do bad. One DTL does not recognize the AM's in the communications to the district. When we ask to take on extra things were told that only SM's can do that. Dont see any path to advance within the district, because DM and DTL's hold us back. High turnover as a result. Training is basic and does not teach you everything.

title: Good Experience and work culture
pros: Good Work/Life balance, Coworkers in your district are like family. Decent workflow especially with office/admin then physical property work. Paid Mileage.
cons: Predatory Sales practices are a big part of the job. Upper management became desperate and overbearing over low metrics or occupancy rates (for example, offering a month's credit to a tenant who's moving out to satisfy the numbers that month) and other nonsensical business practices. Mystery shops were also completely asinine. One wrong step (or mark from the shopper who has to recount from memory) and you're being counseled..

title: Good pay

cons: None that I can really think of

title: It‚Äôs an easy job
pros: Some pros are that the people you work with are great. The job is simple and straight forward, you don‚Äôt need any experience to get an assistant manager position. Every Sunday off
cons: The hourly pay isn‚Äôt great. Especially if you‚Äôre living somewhere like Tampa. It‚Äôs kind of hard to live off the wage. I live alone, and I‚Äôm struggling to only pay for my own stuff. You can‚Äôt get Saturdays off no matter what. It is required you work Saturdays and Mondays which can be annoying bc you never get two days in a row off so basically you never get a weekend. They talk about work life balance but working until 6 everyday it‚Äôs already dark when you get home. With no time to really spend time with friends and loved ones. So work life balance really depends on what you call it. I basically get home eat dinner and by that time I‚Äôm already getting ready for bed to go to bed for work the next day.

title: Okay workplace, greedy company

cons: Management wants to push insurance insurance insurance, and contracts feel like customers need a lawyer with them

title: An Employer That Cares
pros: I have been with Extra Space for nearly 6 years. I never thought I would be working in the storage industry but I can say it is one of the best things that has happened to me. I have worked in for a corporation before and it was not a healthy environment. I can say that Extra Space is one of the best companies I have ever worked for and one that truly cares about it's employees. I have been able to work my way up from an assistant site manager to my current position as a team lead. This shows that Extra Space stands behind their people and are willing to help them to develop a career. The growth potential is only limited to the employees. I truly enjoy that when I go home at night I do not take my work home with me and I am able to spend quality time with my family. Extra Space promotes and has as a core value the importance of work/life balance. There are many companies out there that take from their employees without caring for them. This can not be said for Extra Space. There are way more PROS working for Extra Space than CONS. As this review is already lengthy I will end it by saying that Extra Space is a fantastic place to work with upper management who care about every single one of us.
cons: There is only one true CON I can think of and that would be having the ability to only being open a half day on Saturdays. Though the weekends are typically higher value days, there are several Saturdays were I may not even talk to someone.

title: Wonderful Work Culture
pros: Amazing employees and work environment. Supports a nice work life balance.
cons: Communication between different teams could use some improvement.

cons: One of the down side is cleaning units, however, it is a part of the job description.

title: Best Move I Ever Made
pros: I got my life back when I joined Extra Space over 6 years ago. This company allowed me to grow professionally and take care of my family. The core values are what keep me going every day.
cons: The ever changing world around us has made it more difficult sometimes to handle upset customers, but keeping a cool head and rational thought makes all the difference!

title: Top-Notch Culture
pros: The people at Extra Space are what make working here worth it. The culture is incredibly welcoming and really makes sure that, regardless of your tenure, your contributions are noticed and commended for the good of the company and its employees. There are a multitude of activities that the company and various departments put on to keep their employees engaged and fulfilled. Management also knows the important of work-life balance and is always flexible to accommodate reasonable scheduling conflicts with whatever comes up in life, whether that be routine/one-off appointments, child care, etc. It's not hard to see that they prize employee satisfaction as their first priority over all else, and it's encouraging to see senior management following in those footsteps every single day in the work that they do as they continue to grow the company.
cons: The requirements for remote/office working days can vary from department to department. My department specifically works 3 days remotely and 2 days in the office each week, which can be nice for some that prefer more face-to-face interaction with their teams, but could otherwise be an issue for those that purely want a remote working opportunity. For how large the company is, the compensation for corporate employees is fairly average compared to other similar positions at companies within the Salt Lake City area.

title: Great Employeer
pros:
Amazing Team
Lots of Freedom
Self managed
cons: Compensation was low for the standard living cost of the zip code being employed at.

title: Fabulous Employers
pros: ESS cares strongly for their employees and their free time outside of work. Having one day a week that everyone is off is amazing(Love Sundays). The Teamwork this company possesses is beautiful.
cons: As an AM I am often at my site by myself operating the business; However, for our bonus checks the SM receives a percentage of the AMs incentive. Being as I am at the store and doing rentals so often on my own I feel it is unfair to lose a chunk (aside from taxes) of my incentive when I've done the work to earn it. I also feel that our stores could close slightly sooner. Especially for our parents, who don't get much time with their kids. I feel it may be easier to open earlier so that we can close earlier and have some more time at the end of our days. Say 8:30-5:00 or 8:00- 4:30

title: Working for Extra Space
pros: If I could rate this company higher than a 5 I would. I have been with the company for 5 months, and I wish I would have started here sooner. The environment is amazing, I always get the help I need, I feel valued as an employee, and I love the work life balance. Amazing company to work for!
cons: I don‚Äôt have any cons

title: I was lied to about pay

title: Welcoming Culture
pros: The culture here is amazing, everyone is so kind and welcoming. The company is extremely supportive of work life balance. They also support your day to day decisions. It's the best job I've ever had. The monthly bonuses are also great, its not a huge amount, but it's far better than nothing
cons: Pay and positions. They should change all titles to property manager instead of store manager and assistant as we do the same job anyways. They should be paying us the same, and a lot more. This is still a far better paying job than other places, but still nowhere near enough

title: Hands On Customer Service!
pros: If you enjoy customer service and working with your hands this is the place for you! Every day is full of variety. From the people you meet to the tasks you perform, there is something new around every corner. The customer service aspect is, probably, the most important as many don't realize that needing storage usually involves some kind of serious stress or life change for the person needing it. It's rewarding to be able to make something easier for someone who is going through a difficult time. The other half of the job is working with your hands and getting to be outside instead of in an office all the time. Maintaining the property, fixing things yourself and keeping things running smoothly brings a great sense of accomplishment.
cons: Well, they are sort of the same. That "working outside" part can be a bit of a challenge during times of extreme weather and a stressed out customer can be difficult to deal with. But at the end of a 105 degree day (or an ice day) I think I feel a little more proud of myself for being able to power through. And when that stressed out customer comes in yelling at you and leaves thanking you, well, that's what it's all about!

The hours are great and I feel I am compensated fairly for the the work that is asked of me.

Threats and harassment from customers occur frequently, upper management is discriminatory against married couples and people who choose not to buy a car. The money isn't worth it this time.

title: Best Company
pros: Great place to work because of the people you work with day in and day out. Company has plenty of opportunities to grow and the support system to help you get there is great! And we're closed on Sundays.
cons: We have to work till 5:30 PM on Saturdays.

title: Quick Money, short term gig
pros: The training for the sales process is fairly simple and since it‚Äôs inside sales you don‚Äôt ever have to cold call people. Their system is easy to use and has all the relevant tasks you‚Äôll need to tackle throughout the day; you can contact anyone at other stores which is helpful if you have questions, you‚Äôll usually get an immediate response. Physical work is usually light depending on your main store but you will sometimes have to do big maintenance projects by yourself or with your store manager. Customers are generally easy to work with because they already know what they want.
cons: Atrocious salary and career advancement options, even though you can transfer to any store in the company, usually the only ones available to you will be in your district. There are only 3 role types before District Manager: assistant manager, store manager, and district team lead. Pay between Assistants and Managers is negligible and if you become a DTL you will make only a few dollars more. If you live on site as a manager, they always slash your pay because you‚Äôre receiving free housing, but most of the time it goes below what the assistants make.

title: Good entry level remote job
pros: Supervisors and managers are great. They genuinely care and will do all they can to help struggling sales reps and also develop those who want to move up or within the company.
cons: -Commission payout could be better but is overall decent considering the job requires no experience. -The only holidays you have off are Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Year

title: ask detailed questions during interview
pros: co workers. job can be a little slow so you have down time to focus on other tasks. decent pay. (for the specific duties listed in the job description) you don't work sundays. (unless its a specific location) there aren't that many pros without caveats...
cons: the pay does not match ALL of the job descriptions you have to do. some days you have to randomly paint the curb. some days you have to power wash. some days you'll have to be an exterminator. some weeks you are at SEVERAL different locations so its never the same. they train everybody the same, but not every manager runs their location like everybody else. I'll hand it to my managers/coworkers for training me properly. but they were not 100% honest about everything. I understand they needed another 'hard worker' who doesn't ask many questions. but come on, don't tell me on my first week that "oh this is a crazier/busier week than normal don't worry about it." when EVERY week is like this. sometimes worse. I won't go into detail but be prepared to hold down about 9 different jobs when accepting this ONE....fyi

title: Great job and great benefits
pros: I enjoy working at ESS because of many reasons! some reasons are: SUNDAYS WERE OFF!!, work day ends at 6pm, employees are awesome to work with, the company really cares about their employees, there are always ways to grow in the company (ESS will try to hire within the company before outside). While there are many other reasons these are just a few that intrigued me to want to work for ESS!
cons: Holidays. ESS provides 4.5 paid holidays for its full-time facility employees, unless additional holidays are state mandated. We do not get enough paid holidays off. Which is very hard when you have kids. Another con is when an employee has worked at ESS for many years and hits the "cap" for hourly pay. They no longer get any increases. This is upsetting due to the fact at the end of the year everyone gets a merit review which is when you would get an increase of pay depending on your performance throughout the year and these people are no longer able to get an increase of pay. This is something that needs to change ASAP! How do you expect to keep an employee for over 15 years but not give any incentive to stay with the company? there should not be a "cap" for field employees and if the "cap" is to stay in place there should be other ways ie. bonus checks cut to employees that have hit the "cap" to compensate for not getting an increase in their hourly rate of pay.

pros: Simple job depending on your location.
cons: Lack of communication and focus.

pros:

title: overall a great work environment
pros: I like that extra space values me as an employee. I'm not just someone here to make money for a company, I matter.
cons: trying to get the property up to standards and the cleanliness has been a bit of a challenge, I'm overcoming that obstacle daily though.

title: Such an AWESOME place to work - and grow!
pros: Extra Space's culture is truly something that is hard to find in the workplace. They treat people like... people! Everyone is always more than willing to help out, with a smile on their face. Making sure that you have the support, knowledge, and resources to do your job to the best of your ability is truly the focus. There's more than enough room to grow within the company if you put your mind to it and speak up!
cons: Extra Space is a large business, after all, so it can sometimes take a minute for policy implementations and updates to take effect. There are a lot of channels to communicate through and, for a newer employee, it can take a minute to realize where your questions should be directed. That being said, everyone is always so helpful in pointing you in the right direction!

title: Best company I have ever worked for

cons: -Summer months can be very hot when working outside, but water is provided and breaks are highly encouraged.

title: ESS is a great place to work.
pros: There are numerous opportunities and departments for your career advancement. Many opportunities to work from home and even from out of state. My department which is the NSC (National Solutions Center) has many diverse schedules to choose from and the wages are excellent. Where I am you have the ability to make much more in commission each month, not just your hourly wage. ESS has an excellent work/life balance for everyone. They believe in that balance and wants to make sure it is attained. The core values of the company are important to me‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..Integrity, Excellence, Innovation, Teamwork, and Passion. The company lives these values. ESS is a trailblazer in technology, constantly building and improving on our systems to make them more user friendly for the employees as well as our customers.
cons: Really not a whole lot of cons. Could use more IT Help Desk Techs so they could match the schedule of the NSC; providing assistance no matter the time.

Lack of proper professional communication and little to no care about work-life-balance. They will stop talking to you and ignore you if you choose to try and better yourself.

title: Extra Great Place to Work at.
pros: Coming from the industry, I can say Extra Space Storage is an amazing place to work at, we have great values, great teamwork and the best training in the industry. I am extremely proud of being a part of such STRONG team!!

title: Happiness
pros: I have been with the company a little over 2 years and I have never had worked for a place that cared so much about their employees from our wages and great incentives to where we started out as co workers turned into a team turned into friends and now family we are happy to help one another with goals we like to meet problems we are struggling with and we do it with our whole heart and we are happy to do so and that shows to our customers. Happiness, kind. compassionate, understanding, professional and knowledgeable. We are enthusiastic and value one another and value our customers because our values are who we are and what we stand for. We can depend on each other with the highest integrity we thrive in excellence to give our customers the best experience possible we have passion for the work we do because we get the appreciation from upper management from our team mates just the recognizing that your doing a great job makes you continue to thrive and be the best you can be for you for the team for the company for the customers, You have great opportunities to advance your career at Extra Space, I have never felt so much happiness then I do knowing I have family behind me to encourage, to teach, to help me grow and continue to be the best manager I can for our customers.It's just the right thing to do even if no one is looking.
cons: Some days can be extremely challenging we embrace it. Deadlines to meet can be overwhelming at times we reach out to where even our District Managers will come in to get their hands dirty to finish. Customers can and will get angry about rate increases we take a breath and know we have compassion and understanding to calm the storm and fix the issue after all we are in customer service, Every place of employment we have ups and downs its how we handle the downs that give us our outcome, Sure there are things I think my site could use or would be better and more secure if I had them in place communication is key and patience is what we have to have it all has a process but our voices are heard would I call these cons with Extra Space? Technically yes, however its also teaching me patience its teaching me how to stay calm in frustrating times and helping me grow when im uncomfortable and that will always be more positive then negative

title: It May be an OK Fit For Some
pros: Fellow store managers, assistant store managers & others are great. Everyone helps everyone & pretty much has a positive attitude. It's not a difficult job, it just may be a lot for someone at first.
cons: A lot of work for the pay. There are possible bonuses, but it depends on certain factors. Personally, don't care for property management & borderline harassment of customers/tenants. Also, the company expects you to follow a script to the tee, especially when being reviewed on your performance (being "shopped" - in person or on the phone). As with all companies, the goals are to get more, more, more. More reviews, more money (insurance), etc. Some expectations are a little more difficult to meet than others. One last item - being an ASM, you'll be expected to travel to sister sites when they need coverage (which is why they ask if you have reliable transportation). While there is mileage reimbursement, they calculate the distance for you & if you don't match it, there are going to be issues. Never mind traffic delays, detours, and wanting to arrive at the job on time; just make sure to get Google Maps to track your trips & timing, so there is no discussion of trying to take a longer route to get more money.

title: From Life Storage->Extra Space - Could not be happier!
pros: I transitioned to Extra Space from the acquisition of Life Storage and could not be more satisfied and impressed with how the corporate culture has improved, and the transition to a new team has been so seamless. Everyone at Extra Space has been so welcoming and willing to help with anything I may need. And the workplace atmosphere is so much fun, whether it is in person or remote. I love working here!
cons: Generally no cons, whatsoever! I would say I pay slightly more for my prescriptions/benefits, but you'll have those variances at any workplace. I am fairly new, but the onboarding process was so seamless and the corporate culture is one of the best I've ever experienced.

title: An ok place to work
pros: If you get your work done, you are generally left alone. My co-workers have always been great to work with and I've built meaningful friendships here.
cons: The pay is low. The median employee made about 43k in 2020 and about 46k now in 2022, but with inflation that 46k is worth about 39k in 2020 dollars, so we've all taken pay decreases essentially. Our CEO saw his compensation go from about 6.7 million in 2020 to 11.6 million in 2022. Dealing with customers has become more difficult because their rates are going up faster and much higher in a lot of cases than the market rate for their unit. This pays for executive bonuses and raises, as well as acquiring other storage companies, but not keeping employees at least at the same buying power they had in 2019 when median employee pay was 39k. We're struggling to buy groceries while our CEO has gotten a $6,000,000 raise.

title: Amazing Company to work for and with!
pros: I feel like what I do day in and day out makes a difference. I am appreciated by the company and my supervisor daily. I feel valued and important to each of my customers and feel like what I can do for them makes a difference in their lives. All this while being supported. Working within my team feels more like family. We communicate with each other throughout the day to get support or just to chat. Pay with the ability to earn more with commission is very good. Great benefits, unable to find better out in the private sector. The company is constantly improving systems to better assist our customers and each of our locations. I LOVE my job! There is a lot of growth available for those who earn it!

title: Secret Sauce!!!!!
pros: Extra Space Storage has figured out the secret sauce to long-term success. The secret sauce is to ALWAYS put your employees first. We are a people-focused, people-driven company changing the way individuals have looked at happiness within their careers. I can hold-heartedly say that our Extra Space Storage team has everyone's best interest at heart. It almost sounds too good to be true but you'll see that we continue to expand, impress, and succeed in ways others have never thought possible. All due to the commitment to our people. I hope everyone has a chance to experience true work-life balance, positive work culture, and a psychologically safe work environment in their careers because it will change your life. I am happy, fulfilled, and driven to continue bringing success to my company because they return it to me tenfold.
cons: You'll never want to leave this company! (Not a con, but I truly did not expect to want to stay with one company for the rest of my career but I am not mad about it).

title: Good company that continues to grow and evolve.
pros: 1) Reasonable levels of autonomy 2) Fair pay for DM's 3) Strong company culture 4) Peer and supervisor support 5) Company vehicle and expense account 6) Access to virtually unlimited amounts of data
cons: 1) Very questionable and unfair promotion practices 2) DEI initiatives often trump performance and equal recognition 3) KPI's a strong focus, ignoring that this is a actually a property management role 4) Hiring from outside has resulted in an abundance of people managers who don't actually understand the core business 5) Lean staffing targets create challenges during holidays, rental season, or when adding new stores on short (<30 days) notice

title: Good work place

title: GREAT PLACE TO WORK.

I have been in retail Management for over 35 years, and I can say they spend time with their people and make sure that you understand the process.
cons: Nothing as far as I can tell.

title: Greatest Company to work for
pros: -Flexible hours -Fantastic work-life balance -Great culture -Great career development opportunities
cons: Training is thorough but can be challenging if you do not learn quickly.

title: Used to be great... gone way downhill in the last few years
pros: Opportunity to work at home and remotely.
cons: So many downsides lately. The new sick time policy is a joke. As a 4 day/10 hour worker, I have to work 4 months to earn one day of sick time. Regular 8 hour workers have to work 3 months. I have never had disciplinary action for attendance in my 10 years with the company until they updated the policy. They claim the change was to help us, but it's quite obvious it was to make it harder to call out. God forbid you catch the flu and need more than a day of recovery. With record profits for the company, our executives are seeing huge pay increases, yet the lower level employees are technically making less than we used to with the rising costs of living. The technology issues are worse than ever. It takes weeks to get anything fixed and we are the ones that deal with the customers' backlash over it.

title: Take it easy...

cons: No overtime is permitted unless extremely necessary. The 30 minute lunch breaks feel quick. There's way more to the job then just renting out storage units.

title: Easily the top company in the country to work for.

cons: Cons are nonexistent. If you join the company you hit the lottery.

title: Best Company I've Worked For!
pros: Extra Space has been the best company I've worked for in my career. I've been here for almost 3 years now and during that time I've seen how much the company cares for it's employees. They are constantly looking for ways to improve the work life balance of employees and do the right things for the employees. I have seen it in all parts of the company (field, corporate, and call center). When I first started I kept waiting for "the other shoe to drop". A lot of companies say they are great during the recruiting process, but after you get in the door the shiny and new wears off and you find out it's not great. 3 years later I still find that this company is true to their words.
cons: The environment is very fast paced so sometimes it can be very busy. It's what keeps Extra Space innovative so overall it's not a bad thing, but it can take a little bit to get used to at first.

title: Best place to work

title: Extra space is great!

title: Hiring Commission Pay is Deceiving
pros: Respectful. Intensive training & support. A lot of opportunities to win small gift cards for your effort. Supply all equipment needed to work from home. Friendly team members. Positive work culture and work/life balance.
cons: Quarterly schedule lottery, random positioning in schedule bid is not very random, best positions for highest earners who have been with company the longest, making it difficult for new hires of less than three years to get shifts which pay commissions well. When getting a less-desired, bad schedule, there is little to almost no chance of earning a commission. Commission structure is misleading and too rigid, high service calls to the sales call side ruin the numbers your percentages are structured around, even if your actual sales numbers are high, making it nearly impossible to commission in amounts that are beneficial. Will terminate you if your sales percentage numbers are bad/too low for 3 rolling months (which if you get a bad shift in the bid is the entire quarter) even if your legit sales call percentage are super high, the service calls coming in on the sales side can destroy your overall percentage rate. Passive/aggressive performance reviews where the management acts like the focus is to help and support teams but really is to threaten your position if in the quarter you can not meet their goals. Actually very low paying position, because you are hired with the promise of high commission opportunities to offset hourly pay. Continuously firing team members as well as a high turnover rate from team members leaving due to actual commissions, leaving call center under staffed, which additionally burdens team members with call volume as they take more service calls which throw off the sales numbers. Company continuously tells you the numbers ‚Äúeven out in the end‚Äù which is a flat out lie.

title: Merge

I have never worked for a company that had the higher ups actually introduce themselves the time of on boarding welcoming the newbies, all the way to HR who responds instantly !! The way they help out is really mind blowing! They recognize you for the smallest things I got a cute gift sent to me for my ONE year anniversary I was so confused to why I was receiving this package they literally celebrate every milestone with you if I had to say this is more like my second family and I wouldn't trade my job for the world. I completed my degree this year for my bachelors and decided I'm not ready to step away form my job so I am going to continue my Masters and keep on with my job here at Extra Space
cons: there is nothing to list about conns.
