title: BEST MOVE I'VE MADE!!
pros: Great pay! Don't let base pay scare you. There are commissions, sales bonuses, prizes, and monthly attendance bonuses that add up to make yearly pay great! There is a culture of support for each team member, opportunities to grow and advance your career (even remotely), clarity of expectations, and excellent training. Management listens to employees! Surveys come out regulary and meetings are held to let employee voices be heard. Our requests are given consideration and often changes in policies, procedures, and even commission structure, are made! I love that employees have a real voice in how things are done!
cons: Getting the perfect shift can be difficult but doable! If you excel at sales, you‚Äôll have no problem here. I‚Äôve gotten my first choice on most shift bids. If you take on extra roles like mentor or coach, you have even more assurance of a great schedule.

title: Growing, Leading and Teamwork
pros: *growing company *solid culture *sound values *great work places (stores) *excellent teamwork *allowance for innovation
cons: *corporate employees receive several paid holiday, store employees receive 4 paid holidays

title: Site manager eview
pros: I work alone majority of the time. The work is easy and repetitive
cons: When we have new hire's they leave training and still not have a clue on what to do in the office when they're alone

title: A Company that Actually Lives by Their Culture
pros: When you join Extra Space, you really do join a company that cares about you. You can bring your whole self to work and will see our core values of Teamwork, Integrity, Passion, Innovation, and Excellence in all that we do. I'm encouraged to share ideas and have a voice in decisions that impact me. I'm comfortable expressing when I'm feeling overwhelmed or want more opportunities for development. My manager checks in regularly to provide support and to ensure I have what I need to be successful in my role. I'm trusted, given challenges that help me grow, and am treated like a person, not just another cog in the gears that make the clock tick.
cons: Would like to see more opportunities for remote work; however, there are more opportunities for hybrid roles, so they're meeting us halfway. The office is wonderful to work in, but remote work would expand our reach for talent.

title: A company that actually promotes from within
pros: 1. Pathways to career opportunities for high potential managers. Our COO started as an Assistant Manager. 2. Great company culture 3. Monthly or quarterly bonuses based on position - even entry level. 4. Work - Life balance. A set schedule with Sundays off!
cons: 1. Can deal with unsavory clientele regularly based on your location 2. Dealing with break-ins constantly

title: Beware.
pros: 401K match, some coworkers are amazing people, Sundays off, I've had 3 incredibly intelligent and kind DM's.
cons: Workplace culture is a joke, micromanaging yet we're all supposed to "Act like owners," the opportunity for growth is minimal no matter how hard you work.

title: Great company
pros: Solid culture and team accountability.
cons: Constantly changing priorities and pay.

title: Be ready to clean up copious amounts of human excrements
pros: They take care of us at work and as a company they understand that life happens. The bonuses can be decent each month if you keep up with what youre supposed to do. A regular schedule so you can have a half way decent work/life balance. The job is usually pretty straight forward and there is always something to do to keep you busy. My coworkers are great and upper management is incredibly helpful when it comes down to it.
cons: Some of the biggest issues I have at my location are the people that urinate in the halls or units, leave bottles of urine around the property or in the units when they move out, and have pooped in the stair wells. The amount of stress that comes with dealing with break ins is kind of crazy sometimes. Peoples livelihoods are in these units and when stuff gets stolen, you have to he the one to let the customer know. You have to work with them even when they are angry and yelling at you blaming you for it because, "Its your job to protect their stuff" and etc etc.. just incredibly stressful despite having good back up with the team.

title: Review
pros: Great place to work! Bonuses every month sounds great and free unit for store managers is a great perks to have being with extra space!

title: Pizza is NOT a bonus

Consistently giving out cheap swag and food trucks/pizza parties with no real incentive or motivation. Overworked teams across the board with little support/budgets to build the infrastructure to support a growing company. Also don‚Äôt believe other reviews, they give employees candy bars to complete reviews on glass doors - people sold their souls for a Reese‚Äôs üòÖ

title: A great place to work

title: Hospitality all around

title: ExtraSpaceStorage
pros: *Great Insurance plan *decent work hours *the benefit of a free or half price storage unit is wonderful *nice to be able to help people (customers) *you don't have every weekend off but you can have a weekend off *I Would definitely recommend ESS to Any of My Friends or Family to Work at and to rent with .
cons: *One often works alone. Working alone is stressful, boring, hard and more. *Not always having a coworker in the building makes taking lunches away from the site very difficult. *It is a very large corporation, due to being individual sites vs working all in one building it makes it necessary to do more through the computer then with human contact, and that makes it hard to find answers to basic questions, to understand the wonderful benefits offered, to talk to a human and more. *The work hours are nice but they also make if difficult to be home in the evening early enough to enjoy family time, family dinner and eat at a reasonable time.

cons: Pay is super low for all the work they expect. Depending on management, you can work every Saturday and work at 3/4 diff locations within the week. They expect you to follow the sales script to the LETTER, they even send secret ships who grade you based on wording. And you are suppose to stand up every time somebody walk into your store. Customers can be rude and try to leave trash everywhere and of course, you‚Äôre expecting to clean EVERYTHING‚Ä¶ including bathrooms and people peeing/pooping across the property. Not to mention the daily calls you have to make. I can go on and on, but if you‚Äôre looking for a quick job, this can be it. If you‚Äôre looking for a career, this ain‚Äôt it

pros: Easy Job. Close on Sundays. dental and vision insurance are reasonable.

title: New Hire and No Regrets
pros: AMAZING culture, hybrid schedules, supportive coworkers, great management that trusts you. Not micromanaging at all. Laid back but professional culture. Top leadership is very open and shares information in All Hands. Answered some tough questions from employees as well. DEI program. They develop their people and promote from within. Live and standby core values. Free fruit, snacks, and drinks. Culture of recognition and teamwork. Great benefits and pay. Overall I am so happy with my decision to join #teamextraspace.
cons: Bit of a drive for me, but it is a hybrid schedule so it isn't so bad. Not a drive for those in SLC or Utah counties.

title: Be Prepared
pros: Job itself is not hard, if everything worked the way it should.
cons: Be prepared to be left by yourself with no life line. DTLs and DMs are always ‚Äúout of pocket‚Äù or unreachable when you need help, and when you do ask for help, you‚Äôre ignored. You‚Äôre expected to put in hard work and sweat into a thankless job. Upper management does nothing to motivate employees, and favoritism runs rampant across the company. Everyone acts like they‚Äôre in high school. Even if you do your job by the book, if you aren‚Äôt meeting the KPIs or you aren‚Äôt one of the ‚Äúfavorites‚Äù be prepared to be treated like so. HR is also not helpful, the company makes it hard to even speak with a rep and there‚Äôs zero consequences for anything. Customers can be as horrible as they want and be rewarded for it. They can cuss you out and assault you, but the minute they escalate to a DTL or DM, they get what they want and you‚Äôre left to pick up the pieces. They want you to value the customer who just threatened you because they want their money. Hard to feel motivated to stay at a company that doesn‚Äôt value their employees well-being or safety. Pay is also unfair across the board, there is definitely a gender-wage gap.

title: Company
pros: Only two employees per site
cons: Company kept increasing workload, but not increasing pay.

cons: You don't get paid enough for the work that you do. When cleaning out units, be careful and protect yourself. If not wearing long sleeves, gloves and a face mask - you could end up getting a fungus on your face from how dirty some of the units can be.

title: Poor Communication
pros: There stores that have live on

title: Interesting Projects and Great Culture
pros: The culture of the IT department is collaborative. I've stayed for the excellent culture and we're focused on great solutions with opportunities to implement new technology. Our culture is to architect and deliver long-term solutions and the cross-team collaborative environment has been an excellent source of growth for my career. I have supportive management and mentors. I learn something new everyday. Great work life balance. Great benefits. Remote work with option to go into the office has been fantastic. I have more personal time rather than 2 hours commuting to and from work. Really nice perk.
cons: PTO caps could be higher.

title: Good To Me
pros: I cannot speak for anyone else, but Extra Space has been good to me. I have worked in companies in which unprofessional behavior was tolerated or even encouraged, where manipulation was preferred method of managing and where basic respect was a laughable concept. I have no such issues with Extra Space. Basic common courtesy, a push toward excellence and professionalism and proper training for all aspects of the job are some of the many reasons this is a good place to work. There is room for growth as well as opportunities in different areas, if one chooses to branch out, without leaving the company. In general, Extra Space is a very good company to work for!
cons: There is more encouragement for vertical mobility verses lateral. In other words, sometimes an employee needs to fight or use strategy in order to work in another district or department. I rarely hear district managers or DVP's looking in-house for accountants or when needing to fill positions in nearby districts. These positions ARE listed, but for the most part individuals are guided toward staying in their lanes.

title: Extra Space

title: People make all the difference!
pros: ESS treats their people very well. From a robust benefits package to an actual interest in employee pain points, ESS understand clearly that if they don't care for the people, the people won't care for the business. Success depends on this idea. Development opportunities are available for people without typical background experience and/or formal education, ESS is always looking for the next potential Store Manager, Trainer or District Manager and is not afraid to fill in the knowledge gaps a top tier internal candidate might have. Our values actually matter, they're not just some sign on the Boss' wall. Teamwork, Integrity, Passion, Innovation and Excellence drive everything from the top down.
cons: Our industry involves a large amount of change and while ESS manages this change well it can be tough at times to keep up with all the policy changes as time goes on. Resources abound though and the answer is always there to be found.

title: Great Company to Work for!

Company values are truly lived
good work/life balance

The promotion opportunities never feel worth it due to the discrepancy between the pay and the work load that different sites require. Most of the time, you're dealing with upset customers for one reason or another, and depending on what immediate leadership you're under, you're getting accosted for other matters by them along with it.

title: Great Company

Everyone is friendly and everyone is treated with respect, regardless of your position or time with the company.

title: A Cool Place to Work

Daytime shifts only- Hybrid Job between property janitorial/maintenance work and administrative account management office work. Seems fairly easy to move up positions.
cons: They claim there is strong work/life balance yet you cannot have two consecutive days off as Saturdays and now Mondays are required. On Sundays offices are closed. They also kind of expect you to answer your phone on your days off if you're a store manager and a customer has a problem or there is an emergency- but you aren't being paid to be on-call. You will be expected to do sales on some degree as they grade everything you do and even employ almost predatory secret shoppers to test your processes.

pros: Work from home, remote, makes it easier to balance homelife

title: A great place to work
pros: We have a great management team who encourage and praise the work we have done. Very understanding of personal time and give us the time off we have worked so hard for. The company is very family oriented and give us Sundays and major holidays off. The teamwork structure is emphasized not only in your own district but other parts of the country, especially when there is a natural disaster. The executives come out to visit us and let us know what is happening within the company and also hear our concerns, which no other company I have worked for has ever done. I have tremendous respect and admiration for the structure of our operations and the care and concern for the employees and customers.
cons: We are alone a lot at the stores. We need to be double covered to support the overall day to day operations.

title: GREAT Place!
pros: Self paced, self manage work environment. Work-life balance is great(Always off on Sundays)

title: Positive Culture & Growing
pros: Many benefits, Work life balance is a strong part of the culture.
cons: istency. Strong Senior Management Staff.

title: Good place
pros: Good hours Good pay Good people
cons: Slow work days Saturdays are required workdays

title: Great Workplace
pros: Great leadership, pay, benefits, etc. Nice to feel appreciated at a job and work as a team.
cons: With working most Saturdays, it can be hard to balance work and home sometimes.

title: Out of touch Corporate culture
pros: Will hire with little experience, pays above minimum wage
cons: Corporate is out of touch, thinks telling their sales team "It's good for the stake holders" is an actual incentive. Replaces real reward with small one off gift cards instead of actual pay increases or quality of life improvements

title: Easiest gig ever
pros: Schedule is great for work/life balance
cons: There's really not a whole lot to do, so once your checklist is done, it's kind of a waiting game.

title: Employee review
pros: The quality advice I get from older employees has been the best part of my job. I have worked for jobs who did not care about you as a person and that you are just replaceable. I have health issues and with the heat, sometimes my health is a great concern. They have always made sure I am okay and tell me to take as many breaks from the heat as I need.
cons: ESS expects a lot of out us as employees more than other storage companies. I believe we should get more than just the yearly reviews and balance out the cost of living at the moment. Although I do get paid well, times are hard and even customers are having issues with the rent increases. Of course companies need to keep business alive, there should be a fair thought about the money going towards all ESS is putting in. I would love to keep customers, but things are getting too hard for everyone.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Starting pay is good and we don't require a lot of experience to get you in the door. Low stress environment. The company is always growing so there is always the possibility of advancement, if desired. Great leadership and mentoring. Freedom to "Act Like an Owner"... We are trusted to run multi-million dollar properties, often working alone without being micromanaged. Great benefits and great people. We have a monthly bonus structure that is very fair and honestly, only requires you to do your job to get rewarded. I feel like we are cared for and appreciated every day, it truly is a great place to work.
cons: Minimal Federal Holidays. We do get plenty of PTO so there is the option to use PTO for these days if they are important to you. There is plenty to do when running a site but it is not a "fast-paced" environment. If you need to be in that type of work environment, you may struggle with the pace at many of our sites.

title: Not the best, not the worst
pros: The best part of the job, for me, was being relatively independent. I rarely had to check in with my Regional Manager
cons: The worst part was the rent increases. There's a predatory business model wherein once a tenant has stayed for 4 to 6 months, their rent drastically increases. Obviously, I had to deal with lots of rightfully upset customers. Also, auctions weren't great.

title: Eh its okay
pros: Working from home Nice leadership
cons: Not much flexibility for PTO, if you're part time you get no PTO at all. You need to accrue the PTO, if you do not have enough PTO when you need to request the dates you need to wait until you have enough to request it. You can request up to a week before but if there's no more PTO left to give then you're screwed. No sick time, just emergency time off which is 1.30hr every 2 weeks (also accrued) if you are sick or have an emergency but no ETO hours good luck to you. Not much flexibility at least if you're not in management

title: A company with great values
pros: opportunity for growth, job security, fun environment, friendly and dependable leaders, sense of belonging, inclusivity, emphasis on innovation and standing out above the competition, good working hours, bonuses for rentals and sometimes holidays
cons: living on site presents some challenges such as customer issues outside of the office hours, we work most holidays except for July 4th, Thanksgiving, Xmas, and New Years, getting after hours calls from the call-center

title: Double Standards
pros: The store hours are good
cons: Be prepared to get dirty and sweaty

title: A cultural fit!
pros: Great company culture that is currently cultivated even with amazing growth. Awesome advancement opportunities based on your experience and talents, not seniority.
cons: Occasional work/life imbalance, not from the company but from the position itself.

title: Amazing Company with room for growth
pros: Extra Space Storage is a great company that believes in promoting from within. Always great support from peers and upper management. Always with family on Sundays since they are closed. Hours are great to take the kids to school and hit the gym before work. Always learning and growing with a chance to get out of the office and do other tasks that keep you moving around with a chance to go outside and get some vitamin D
cons: No Paid sick days, you have to take them from your vacation time which makes people work sick. Also running short staffed so you feel alone alot and it's imposible to get tasks done. No help and no relief in site. Closing hours could be better to really improve the work life balance since we now have web rentals and a call center that does rentals. Maybe a 9-5 now that their are other options for renting the spaces.

title: Sets the standard
pros: From the moment I joined this company, I have felt valued, appreciated, and cared for by both management and my colleagues. In my professional journey, I have never encountered a company that so effectively fosters a family-like atmosphere. What truly sets Extra Space Storage apart is the unwavering support I have received from everyone at the National Solution Center, regardless of their job title. From leadership to my team members, the commitment to collaboration and assistance is exceptional. Company culture is extremely important, and Extra Space Storage has truly excelled in this aspect. I am deeply thankful for the company's commitment to fostering a positive and inclusive culture. Thank you Extra Space Storage.
cons: I personally do not have any cons to mention about this company or my position

title: Great Place to Work
pros: The people are awesome to work with.
cons: Having to submit our schedules so far in advance.

title: Aggravted
pros: The pay rate is decent.
cons: The downside to Extra Space to me is the way they make all employees work every Friday, Saturday and Monday. A lot of these stores has a perfect schedule that has been working for them for the longest. It was worked around family time and other things. With the schedule now there is time for family and other things. I myself is a very family orientated person and spends as much time with them as I can. with the new schedule it's not possible to even see them as the have work during the weekdays.

title: Great Culture,
pros: -The work culture is excellent, there's a healthy respect for work/life balance, they have robust Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion groups and programs, they promote from within and almost everyone is vested in your success. I started as an entry level Assistant Manager and worked my way up to a District Manager, and I'm not the exception to the rule, half my peers have a similar development path. -Lots of opportunities for growth, especially with the recent LSI merger. -The benefits package offered is pretty good, health, dental, vision, 401k, stock grants, etc
cons: -Pay scale (not including benefits) is lower for comparable positions then its peers -You get an extraordinary amount of support and development, but the learning curve is steep for a District Manager especially if you experience doesn't entirely overlap with scope of responsibilities and work required.

title: Poor managment
pros: Can be a live on manager at a facility that has an apartment available (or made available as some District Managers will promise a place to someone, and fire people to open that spot for them)
cons: Depending on what district manager you report to will probably decide how your job goes here. I was a live on manager. I had a seizure for the first time in my life at this apartment(lasted 9 minutes, had some brain damage). We found black mold on the property, in the vents, the ceiling tiles were covered with it, even some of the units that people stored their items in, had mold inside (that ruined their items). Had a quote to clean the mold. Didn't get approved because they wanted other work to be done first. The vendors that Extra Space had for the other work, would never answer or respond. So it was never done. 4 months after my seizure, I was fired. Because I couldn't drive, and my assistant manager had forgotten the deposit in the back, and it was forgotten until I was asked where it was. (My wife had also worked for Extra Space, as a DTL. She had been moved every year , being promised promotions(which she received until this last move). After our district manager started fast tracking other people and telling my wife she wouldn't be getting a promotion for quite a while, she left. Another reason I believe I was targeted to be removed/fired).

title: Great Place to Work
pros: I have been working at Extra Space for two years and what I enjoy most is working with the people here. Lots of people at Extra Space are passionate about their work making it a great place to grow professionally. The collaborative environment makes the work days enjoyable and productive. Additionally, the people have made me feel like a valuable team member since day one of joining the company. I enjoy that there is always more to learn as the company is always growing. Managers are supportive and invested in the growth of their employees and promote a healthy work life balance.
cons: One area that Extra Space could improve is by providing more comprehensive and structured programs to help employees prepare for advancement at all levels within the organization.

title: Almost perfect
pros: Work life balance - You only work during store hours so you are able to be home at a decent hour you get the important holidays off and Sundays to spend with your family. independence - They trust you to do your job and be your own person. the upper management isn't consistently behind your back micromanaging you. They keep their eye on you from a distance and then step in every so often to make sure everything is going good and you don't need assistance with anything Training - It is easy (for the most part) to get help or training on anything you may have questions about.
cons: Pay - Where as the pay is (somewhat) competitive it is not the best, especially with all the inflation that is obviously not going anywhere it is getting tough having to live so tightly paycheck to paycheck. If I didn't have a roommate I wouldn't be surviving right now.

title: Simply The Best
pros: The culture is phenomenal; inspiring, supportive, encouraging leadership. The team I'm on is like my family. In all my 30+ years of being employed. I've never enjoyed the people I've worked with this much. This company strives for excellence, which I'm so grateful to be a part of.
cons: ETO (Emergency Time Off), I had to get used to this. I'm used to getting PA (personal abscence-sick time) with time paid, along with PTO. Here theres just PTO and ETO, the ETO you don't get paid for and takes a while for the ETO hours to accumulate. Since the position is remote, I feel I understand why it's done this way.

JoAnn great DM communication and very understandable. Jacky over at Alhambra is awesome trainer and Ed great support and always there no teach us when obstacles on the way. Ana is a Store Manager always there to help out visit you at any site needed for anyone.

title: Best In the Industry

title: Great Place to Work!!!
pros: I have been with ESS for 12 1/2 years now. I started as an Assitant Manager and with support, development, and patience I am now a district manager. Extra Space not only understands that in order to be successful you must be customer-centric but they also have found the secret to taking care of their employees as well. From the top leaders to the manager onsite everyone is supportive and lives by our compass. The pay is reasonable, I have a work-life balance, and my supervisor is understanding support and fair but most importantly it's a fast-growing company with tons of opportunities. If you want growth, stability, and a work-life balance this is a great place to work.
cons: I can't think of many cons or reasons anyone wouldn't want to work here. Unless you are not motivated to go above and beyond to strive for top performance. ESS is big on being the best and pushing fairly to meet goals and be successful.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: There is so much diversity, the environment is very friendly, easy communitcation with higher level management
cons: Closing at 6pm, extra space storage talks about a good work live balance, but for working parents 6pm is not ideal. Daycares close at 5:45-6:00pm and do not leave wiggle room for that policy. Finding childcare with these hours have been a stuggle my entire career here at Extra Space. I'm positive i'd want to continue my career here indefinitely if not for the hours.

title: One of the best companies to work for hands down
pros: Great job, great District manager to work for, great location.
cons: I had to move. Couldn't transfer.

title: A Company That Actually Cares
pros: Fantastic HR team that looks after its employees. I have had so many positive things to say about the HR and management team that would not fit in this tiny box. However, the compassion and humanity that these people have for their employees is second to none. They have so many programs in place to assist employees in cases of emergency, or life changing events.
cons: Metrics are a necessity at every company, I guess, to make sure people are doing their job. Much is the same here. They have certain numbers that you have to meet, which can cause stress and anxiety.

title: Assistant TO the Manager, Be Warned!
pros: Work life balance. Sundays are guaranteed off, holiday pay and consistent with your chosen weekday off.
cons: Be warned! If you become an Assistant Manager here, I have a few lessons for you I had to learn the hard way. These warnings are specifically for the Morganton/Hickory NC area although the company as a whole has a high turnover! 1. Make sure to ask to meet the staff that you‚Äôll actually be working with, it‚Äôll make all the difference on your first impression of what the workplace culture will actually be like! I only interviewed with the district manager and trainer. Once I met the actual staff I had to work with, the entire mood changed! I experienced a lot of racial micro-aggressions, unprofessionalism, hypocrisy and laziness from my Store Managers and one of my trainers. 2. Although you have the title ‚ÄúAssistant Manager‚Äù, it is just you and a Store Manager in the store. I was led on to believe I was in a leadership position working alongside a Store Manager over staff, but that is not the case! So make sure you‚Äôre working with a great store manager with actual professional management skills, otherwise you might end up being treated like the Store Manager‚Äôs personal assistant doing the dirty work and their scapegoat when something goes wrong like I was. 3. This particular district, if they don‚Äôt like you, for whatever reason, they will attempt to manage you out. Which means making your job more difficult and having you document your progress as a legal justification for terminating you. Luckily I‚Äôm a hard and professional worker because this little trick of theirs did not work. I ended up being with the company for almost a year before I finally found something else and quit! 4. The company looks and sounds professional on paper, but on the actual district and store level, they are not! They are not preparing the Store Managers (who you will be working under) for actual leadership positions. A huge evidence of this is that the managers don‚Äôt even train you, you‚Äôll have a trainer travel to you for that and leave once your training is over. Unless you get lucky and you work in the same store as your trainer. This creates an environment of entitled Store Managers who are protected by favoritism and having longevity with the company. There‚Äôs only ‚Äúslap on the wrists‚Äù if they do wrong in this particular district. 5. Know your worth. If you‚Äôre interviewing and you know the pay is low and they try to entice you with annual or performance based pay raises, don‚Äôt settle! I was ‚Äúmeeting expectations‚Äù at the end of the year and I received a thirty cent raise. Even ‚Äúexceeding expectations‚Äù will be less than a $1 raise. 6. This is a dirty, outside and at times dangerous and sketchy job. They don‚Äôt disclose or elaborate on this too much during the interview process, so allow me to. Don‚Äôt let the temperature controlled office setting fool you. Especially if you‚Äôre the Assistant Manager. You‚Äôll spend majority of days outside cleaning out every storage unit on these gigantic properties the second someone moves in or out, rain or nighttime, which can be full of pests. Homeless people sleeping on the property or inside the units is a huge thing, which can be a dangerous, dirty or awkward situation to run into. Creepy/sketchy things do happen. There are most days where you‚Äôll cover the store alone, so keep that in mind. This particular district, I was consistently working by myself not even a full week out of my training when I was told it would be at least a month before that happened. You are this company‚Äôs pest control, landscaper, handyman and plumber because they‚Äôll do anything to save a quick buck. If you like your personal space, too bad, because you are required to drive customers in the front seat beside you in a golf cart to their storage unit. You also have to do bill collecting calls for customers who haven‚Äôt paid their bills, so be prepared for some seriously angry customers because they can‚Äôt get in their units or their items are being auctioned off! But again if you have a great Store Manager that views you as an equal, then you won‚Äôt have to worry about all the dirty work being put on just you. 7. As an Assistant Manager, know that majority of your days will be spent covering other stores. I was told maybe a day or two I will be covering my neighboring stores, which are each thirty minutes away from my home store. In reality I spent three out of 5 days every week at these other stores and I had no control over my schedule or where I would be. You‚Äôre basically a pawn piece for these managers, you go where they want you to with little concern for how you feel about it.

title: Discriminatory
pros: None. Hostile work environment replete with habitual abuse and condescension. False allegations rendered with no substantive proof of any statements of "authority."
cons: Terminated me citing a falsified criminal background to avoid the true reasoning that would implicate them. They are currently being investigated by the EEOC for disability, sex, and sexual orientation discrimination. The primary bad actor is under criminal investigation for her actions. Disclaimer: all are known reported facts not open to argumentation or modification.

title: You make it what it is
pros: Daily and weekly processes keep things running smoothly. Planning ahead with team members and collaborating to meet monthly goals is a plus. Hard work and dedication is a must, and keeping in contact with your District team leaders and District Managers are great and a wonderful help to get you through difficult situations.

title: No so great
pros: The people you work with at the stores are normally great to work with. Pretty good benefit package and time off.
cons: If you like being micro managed and told what to say and exactly how to say it , so that all your personality is taken away and you are now a robot, then this is the job for you. You feel like a used car salesman without a soul. You are given several goals to reach. In the 5+ years I've been here no manager can make all of them so they use this to give you a 3% raise. Turn over is extremely high. At best this is a place to get some pay and insurance until you find a real job that appreciates what each individual has to offer a workplace. Also if you work after store hours to help a customer they are too cheap to pay you and will expect you to take a longer lunch so that they don't have to pay you overtime. One last thing, when I started it was not like this. Things have made a turn over the past few years and definitely not for the better.

title: Great Place to work
pros: 1)Company really cares about you as an individual. 2)Work schedule is way better then retail could ever be. (NO SUNDAYS!) 3)Upper management really seem to care how you are doing and try to help were you need it. 4) Everyone is very nice company wide and treat you with respect. 5) The pay is great and competitive. 6) Inclusion is a big part of the company 7) Great opportunity to advance.
cons: 1) depending on your store that you can be at, it can be overwhelming because you can be by yourself most days. (answering all calls, handling customers etc.) 2)If you are an assistant you float between stores most times, so you wont be in the same store day to day. Your schedule can change quickly depending on what's going on in your district.

title: Extra Space Storage - Teamwork, Integrity, Respect
pros: Many companies claim to care for their employees; Extra Space proves it year in and year out. I am proud to work for a company that thinks of their people just as much as their profit. The company values of Teamwork, Excellence, Innovation, Integrity and Passion are on display and not just a poster on a wall or words on a mission statement. Transparency is on full display as well which makes everyone feel to be part of something bigger than the role we serve with the company. A great mix of people and diversity that enhances the work experience as well.
cons: From a district level, we want to be at our facilities, interacting with our team and customers. The administration piece and the constant follow up with vendors does take some strategic balancing but this is a minor con and one that we all deal with from a multiunit management perspective.

title: Working for ESS
pros: The best part if working with ESS is that they are so willing to help always. Weather that be with work or you have an emergent family situation. The people here have been more than kind and so helpful making sure I Have all the tools to do my job correctly.
cons: I think the ONLY con I have for working for ESS is the shift bid, but that is probably because it is new to me. I was hoping for more options for the weekends off to spend with my kiddos. But it always has worked out, and I have not had to miss many of their events since starting with ESS.

title: Great People, Room for Growth
pros: It's a great culture because of the great people. You're compensated fairly and have opportunities for growth. It's a very stable company and currently the largest self-storage company in the nation by number of locations. Teams are still lean and the company functions more like a smaller company, despite its size; pros and cons because of that.
cons: Working remotely varies greatly, with some teams not working remotely at all and others working remotely 100%, or a hybrid in-between. Check in your interview what the norm is for the team/position you're applying to.

title: Ain't What It Used to Be

title: Great Place to Work

Our core hour workday and WFH days also provide flexibility to make a work schedule that best suits us individually. I also appreciate that Extra Space asks for feedback from their employees regularly and has accommodated those requests when possible. There are also several perks such as snacks and drinks provided by the company, fun holiday celebrations, and family summer parties. Overall, a really great place to work.
cons: Health Insurance could be better.

title: Neutral

cons: Hours 9:30a-6p, I commute to work having these hours with children are tough, working every Saturday and not having any complete weekends off without a request requiring you to use PTO, 30 days in advance. Your two off days are not together, they offer no sick or personal time, only accrued PTO which you must use for sick, vacation, personal, with about 6 hours per pay period accrued takes a long time to accrue the first year, goes to about 4 hours after that, then 5 years with company goes up.

title: Call center

title: Awesome Company that Truly Cares about their Employees
pros: Imagine the stress of knowing your company is merging with another, and you might not have a job. From the moment the people of Extra Space Storage (ESS) stepped into my world, all stress melted away. I quickly experienced how everyone, from the CEO to management to coworkers, welcomed me like family. ESS is a company of teamwork where the employees work as hard as they play. Work/Life balance is essential, and ESS walks the talk. If you are lucky to work for a company where all the employees have smiles on their faces, it‚Äôs the best!
cons: I've only been with the company for 2 months but so far smooth sailing.

title: Great Company
pros: Working at Extra Space everyone is willing to assist with any questions you may have. Company has a great PTO/attendance system. Company does a great job listening to their employees regardless if it's negative or positive to make the company better as a whole. Extra Space is very upfront, and you know what is expected of you. Extra Space has a lot of tools in place to help you succeed. Extra space is very diverse, and have great benefits.
cons: I do not have anything negative to say because Extra Space like their employees to be open so they can provide a great company balance and work on improvements when needed.

title: Great
pros: Great company to work for

title: Great Employer
pros: Good hours, teamwork atmosphere, decent pay for work

title: Great Experience
pros: Management actually cares about their employees. Healthy work life balance. Superior culture that is a forethought to employment not an afterthought. Good benefits. Collaborative. Friendly. Fun.
cons: I mean it's storage. I frequently find myself needing to explain why a storage company (actually a real estate company) needs so much tech. Its not always sexy, but the underlying technical mechanisms are quite complex and there are many challenging problems to solve. I probably shouldn't feel so obligated to explain my job to friends anyways!

title: Can‚Äôt work for dishonest employer
pros: Plenty of time to read a good book.
cons: They train you to misrepresent their product. You are selling ‚Äúinsurance‚Äù but you‚Äôre NOT an agent. You are told to tell the customer the insurance is comprehensive but if you read the fine print it‚Äôs not. I was too honest to be comfortable doing this job.

title: Customer and Employee Focused
pros: They listen to employees, make changes based on feedback we provide, and give us the ability to help our customers without always needing to reach out to tiers of people above us, within reason of course, but far more ability to take the lead at our site as long as we are meeting our goals within company policy. They are less micro managing than some companies as long as you are completing your work, which is really nice, and do provide you with pretty much what you need to make the job doable, within reason.
cons: Honestly, not too much is a con here. My current site is slower, so it's normally just myself which can be a con as it falls to me only to really handle all the tasks daily, but not a big issue. Other sites you do have a peer you work with most days which makes tasks easier. Maybe a con would be that some people can be gross and you sometimes need to clean up rather gross things, but that isn't a very common situation, thankfully.

title: Corporate
pros: Liked the work and the opportunity to work outside
cons: Very corporate, sale, sale, sale

title: Great company culture
pros: Leadership lives by our company values of teamwork, passion, excellence, integrity, and innovation. If you are looking for a great place to work, with a good work/life balance Extra Space is for you. Opportunity and job stability is also another great reason to come work at Extra Space.
cons: When I was interviewing with this company, I asked someone that worked here what the con was. They said we have to do audits, and it is hot outside sometimes. I figured if the only bad thing was that I had to do an audit when it was hot this must be a great job.

title: A little sales, a lot of abuse from customers

title: Full time property manager
pros: Guaranteed two days off - one week day, and Sunday Rental incentives for site managers are great In my experience, the DM's are amazing and uplifting
cons: Some of the KPI's are just ridiculous - google reviews being one. Working Saturdays unless you have PTO (so it isn't exactly a con)

title: It Was Fine....
pros: I enjoyed working in my district and with my team.

title: Culture comes first
pros: I am proud to work for ESS because we really put the company culture front and center - we strive for Innovation, Excellence, Passion, Teamwork, and Integrity. These are pervasive in what we do and how we make decisions. We strive to bring the best on board with us and develop them for internal promotion. We're undergoing constant growth and change and we want to ensure our team is capable of rising to the challenge.
cons: The change that all this brings can sometimes be hectic and stressful. I'd say as far as high stress jobs go this is on the low end of that scale, but that doesn't mean that as a people manager it comes with no stress. Dealing with turnover can be very stressful for yourself and your team as you need new people before others leave you. When sites are covered by one person it becomes hard to schedule people and coverage.

title: Review

Good benefits

cons: Nothing good place to work.

title: Amazing Company!
pros: My favorite thing about Extra Space is the culture. It's hard to find such a large successful company that also cares about each individual and Extra Space does just that. I have always felt that my voice has been heard and leadership cares about my development as much as I do. It is very apparent that people come first here! I also really love the focus on diversity and inclusion, which makes it a safe place for employees to be themselves.
cons: Honestly, company as a whole, there are not any big cons. Obviously, there are people or teams that can improve because nobody is perfect, but Extra Space really is a wonderful company to work for.

title: Bad Managment
pros: one of the nicer storage companies as far as office
cons: horrible management and leadership. they do not care about their employees

title: Great Place to work
pros: Extra Space is a great place to work, Working for Extra Space gives you the opportunity to think and work like an owner. Every day feels like your home. Everyday is different and there is so much change and growth within the company . Very supportive Bosses to go to and they never put you down. Teamwork is amazing and there is so much to learn. Some days are super busy and some days are slow. We also have Great DTL'S to go to when you feel lost and need some help.
cons: The only con I see is the groups that we have to sign up for .I feel it bring division between employees instead of bringing us together . We should be all one group together that has to do with work only.

title: Work with the best Teamwork, Innovation and Excellence
pros: Worked for Extra Space Storage for 8 years, after they bought the storage company I worked for at that time. The difference in companies was unbelievable. Extra Space appreciates their employees far more than any other company I ever worked for. Extra Space respects their employees, their employees ideas and treats everyone with dignity from their employees at every level to their customers. When market rates in the area increase, Extra Space increases rates or gives bonuses. Really too many great reasons to work for Extra Space Storage to list including a hefty uniform and shoe allowance, always improving benefits, working with employee scheduling, tons of opportunities for development and growth, etc. There are Vice Presidents for the company that started as Assistant Store Managers so employee development and growth is very real!
cons: Can not think of any.

title: Fantastic environment and great work.
pros: Extra Space offers a friendly work environment with a lot of clarity from the upper management. I rarely feel like I am not being included with upcoming changes, events, and information relating to the business itself. There is a lot of freedom of communication between stores within your district and even to other districts within the company. I always feel like I have the assistance I need and the upper managers care about the employees. The job itself is engaging and satisfying and you will feel like you are making a difference in helping other people with their storage needs, especially when you know some of them are going through hard times.
cons: There aren't alot of cons about this company, the only gripe I can say I have with the benefits is that the health plan is not the best and is a high deductible. I really wish Extra Space Management would expand our health benefits and get rid of the HDP plan while keeping the prices we pay monthly about the same. Otherwise Dental is fair and vision is fair.

title: Good but not enough

cons: Bad organization of the employer

title: Excellent culture and lots of room to grow!
pros: -The people hired here are good, down to earth, smart, generous people -Upper management is committed to the personal growth of people on their team -Flexible hybrid schedule, leaders trust their team to get their job done -Leaders are trustworthy, open to ideas, and will listen to requests of their team -Fun company culture with events, parties, monthly games, fantasy football/march madness competitions, etc.
cons: -Not all departments have the same flexibility -Open office - can be difficult to focus when in office with a lot of people around -Room for improvement with compensation to keep up with inflation -Parental leave lacking for new dads

title: Extra Space is not just a job, it's a lifestyle!
pros: Working at Extra Space Storage, is more than just a job. Its a way of Life! The values here, the people, culture, diversity, and just all around work life balance and continued growth is what makes ESS home for me. Im just so grateful to be part of such a successful organization that focuses on people and helping both employees and customers to a better tomorrow.
cons: I do hope to see ESS build a presence outside of the United States. With qualities and culture like ours, I know we have what it takes to make a global impact both nationally and internationally.

title: Good Environment

title: Good job bad for stepping stone experience
